The FortiGuard Systems Engineer team is a special strategic engagement team. They combine data science with security strategy, and facilitate tactics to support security portfolio planning. Systems Engineers are specialized in FortiGuard support and industry threat expertise, with deep knowledge in threat intelligence/campaign awareness, exploits and penetration testing, artificial intelligence and advanced malware concepts. This team engages at all levels of an organization, requiring excellent communication, presentation and thought leadership skills. Systems Engineers must have a strong presence in the security industry, the ability to network and create strong relationships, and articulate both high-level and detailed expert industry knowledge. The position can require a high amount of travel in support of sales and marketing events.

We are looking for a Fortiguard Systems Engineer to work in a demanding, exciting and engaging field. The Systems Engineer role works within the Office of the CISO, working closely with the Security Insights team to provide subject matter expertise in security, threat and C-Suite perspective. Main responsibilities will include:

• C-suite engagement
Executive briefings (EBC)
Thought leadership and brand building
Keynote/plenary speaking to large audiences
Support key strategic threat alliances
Knowledge transfer and empowerment
Support for presales for large revenue opportunities
Mentorship and training sales and marketing resources

This role will work closely with other departments at Fortinet, such as FortiGuard labs, to obtain the latest industry trends and knowledge regarding FortiGuard research & development.

The Systems Engineer will also be responsible to communicate the broad portfolio of FortiGuard security solutions including antivirus, intrusion prevention, Web content filtering and anti-spam capabilities. These services help protect customers against application and network layer attacks. FortiGuard Services are updated by FortiGuard Labs, which enables Fortinet to deliver a combination of multi-layered security intelligence and zero-day protection against new and emerging threats.

Systems Engineer Responsibilities:
Be an excellent speaker who can articulate technical concepts into easily understood terms for a given target audience
Possess technical acumen, focused on FortiGuard services & technology (primarily AI, Antivirus, IPS, Web filtering, Antispam)
Engage in public speaking while representing Fortinet as an industry thought leader
Work with marketing groups to create leads from existing security alliances and relationships
Create new content for use in presentations, whitepapers, blogs, and other media
Deliver executive briefings at the corporate EBC site and at customer locations
Deliver technical presentations, internal webcasts and engineer/sales team knowledge transfer
Demonstrate FortiGuard security concepts in relation to Fortinet product, most importantly APT and threat intelligence
Liaison and support strategic relationships when required such as Cyber Threat Alliance, CERT, and other security industry initiatives
Collaborate closely with the sales team and clearly position Fortinet as the industry leader when compared to competitors
Required Skills:
Technical concept translation to a C-level environment
Be a leading industry and subject matter expert
Very strong presentation, speaking, and overall presence skills
5+ years of experience in the security industry with similar experience as provided here
Understand malware and sandbox concepts (PE32/64 Windows); ARM/mobile is a bonus
Understand security vulnerability and exploit lifecycles
Penetration testing framework (ie: Metasploit) experience is a valuable asset
The ability to network and build trust relationships at all levels of an organization
Articulate and communicate effectively to technical and business leaders
Clearly understand the competitive security landscape and be able to discuss differentiators in regard to APT defense
Work closely with the SE/CSE community, to ensure the growth of Fortinet products and accounts in their region
Carry quarterly and annual revenue targets that are linked to sales support
Education:

Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Graduate degree preferred.

Overview

This Statement of Work covers the need for the services of a college student to provide analytical and technical support in the field of computer engineering, mathematics, physics, statistics, and computer science to produce and implement capabilities for the CMV-22 (tilt-rotor aircraft) Comprehensive Automated Maintenance Environment-Optimized / Readiness Integration Center (CAMEO/RIC) project. The purpose of this task is to perform data analytics and engineering in support of air and sea platforms in the Advanced Data Analytics and Engineering Branch.

The Space and Naval Warfare Systems Center (SSC) Pacific’s mission is to conduct research, development, test, evaluation, operation, sustainment, maintenance, and implementation using technologies that contribute to improving the responsiveness, capability, readiness, reliability, and survivability of Department of Defense’s (DoD) systems.

Responsibilities
Investigating, analyzing, and reviewing data analytics tools and technology to include, open source software, vendor products, academia and industry research studies, and Government software and systems.
Performing data conditioning principles and techniques for performance and system utilization efficiencies associated with big data infrastructure.
Performing in-depth analysis using machine learning, statistical models, and algorithms for the purpose of extracting high value meaning and interpretation of complex data sets.
Performing data visualization techniques in support of analysis to highlight data importance, relative importance, as well as changes and trends to the data.
The contractor shall assist with technical white papers, source code, and algorithms for the CMV-22 CAMEO/RIC project.

JOB SUMMARY
Plum is seeking an experienced CRE mortgage broker or lender with a track record of developing opportunities and closing loans in Austin and / or the surrounding area. Reporting to our Chief Operating Officer, you will leverage our data science, your existing network, and your research to build a network of commercial real estate owners and their advisors, and initiate discussions with owners when they need financing. You will initially train at our HQ in San Francisco and once in the field, continue to work closely with our San Francisco team to agree on terms with the owner, and convert interest into loan applications.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Build a network of CRE owners and their advisors in your metro area and around Texas.
Initiate discussions with owners at the time when they need financing; qualify and follow through on opportunities to agree loan terms.
Work with the owner, advisors and the San Francisco based CRE team to move loans through to application stage. Step into the process as needed to maintain engagement and progress with all parties.
Develop strong working relationships that will lead to future business.
Work with the marketing team to develop strategies to support your development of a network of owners and advisors.
QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of CRE origination experience in Austin or nearby regions, working for a bank, brokerage company, investment bank, or other lending institution.
Good working understanding of credit analysis, underwriting and CRE lending.
A prior track record of success in sourcing and closing $1-25 million CRE loans.
An existing network of relationships in Nashville.
Experience using persuasive, solutions-based selling skills.
Ability to connect quickly with people in an outgoing, friendly and professional manner.
Highly driven, focused and self-motivated, with a demonstrated ability to work remotely.
Demonstrated entrepreneurial behaviors.
An undergraduate degree.
State real estate license where required.
BENEFITS
Comprehensive on-site training at our headquarters in San Francisco.
Early equity in a financial technology startup.
Competitive package of base pay, commission and stock options.
Generous health, dental and vision coverage for employees and family members, along with commuter pre-tax program.
Unlimited vacation.
Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the building of a company and culture.
Autonomy, flexibility and a flat corporate structure that gives you the opportunity for your direct input to be realized and put into action.
ABOUT PLUM
Plum is a financial technology company using data science and artificial intelligence to develop proprietary insights about commercial real estate markets, properties, owners and loans. Plum is using this knowledge to reimagine the business of connecting sources of capital with owners, making the financing process fast, simple, efficient and reliable for everyone.
The team includes former senior leaders and talent from AIG, Goldman Sachs, KKR, McKinsey, PWC, Sony, and Wells Fargo. We have extensive experience with CRE sourcing, underwriting and funding processes, as well as deep networks of institutional financing channels. Our founder and CEO, Bill Fisher, has decades of experience building successful startup businesses including GetSmart.com, Xing and Trivago.
In April 2018, Plum announced a Series B equity investment by the $35 billion hedge fund, Elliott Management. Plum’s Series A round in August 2015 was led by Renren Inc, who has backed other fintech companies including SoFi, LendingHome and Motif Investing. This followed an earlier seed investment by QED Investors, a pre-eminent VC firm led by the founders of Capital One, whose portfolio includes Prosper, Orchard and ApplePie Capital.
Plum is headquartered in the heart of San Francisco’s Financial District in an airy, industrial loft, close to all forms of public transportation.

Job Code - 40492105

Code Pilot is replacing the crusty old resume with a data science based portfolio for engineers, and we're looking for a Software Engineer to join the family of one of our hiring partners.

We are looking for:

A new team member to support the development of a platform for one of our hiring partners.

What will keep you challenged?
Participate in the entire development process from planning the architecture to quality assurance and implementation of the platform.
Promote the design and development of new innovative features from the technical side.
Develop your own ideas for code and process improvements.
Assure the quality of the application through regular code reviews.
Share and expand your knowledge by exchanging information with our network of developers about backend best practices.
Support the integration of relevant new technologies.
Which traits contribute to your success?
Passion - for software development (algorithms, design patterns, clean code, agile processes, data structures).
Humility - Outstanding engineers display inverse proportions of talent to humility.
Mission Oriented - A dogged commitment to getting the job done is crucial.
Highly Competent - Software Engineering at the top level requires highly motivated individuals who are constantly learning and adapting.
Highly Adaptive - Mike Tyson said it best, "Everyone has a plan 'till they get punched in the mouth." Developing software at the top level requires incredibly adaptability and agility. Nothing ever goes the way you want, and anything valuable probably doesn't exist the way you want it.
Ship or Quit - High performance software teams have one unifying quality, they ship, a lot. So if you're a fellow Ship talker, you'll love it here.
Some technologies you will be working with:
Docker, Gitlab, Python, HTML, CSS, Javascript, MongoDB, Relational and noSQL, AWS
Why Code Pilot?

Code Pilot is a new startup and relatively unheard of. We're currently 4 people, all co-founders, based in Austin, TX. Given the rigor and process we adopt to hire engineers, you might be asking yourself, why invest your time and effort to simply apply?

We're hoping if you've reached this part of the posting, you've already noticed the care and attention we've invested in how we hire engineers. We're not interested in the instant gratification someone can provide by being able to "code", and frankly, as an engineer who is passionate about the craft, you shouldn't be either. We're passionate about the discipline of engineering, and what it takes to develop world class engineers. To that end, we don't care if you've got 1 year or 20 years experience, we don't care if you went to MIT or are self-taught, hell, we don't care if your favorite programming language is Ruby (although we will help you forget everything you know about it pretty quickly). What we care about is your insatiable desire to be pressure tested in a credible engineering environment that brings out your best.

Who is Code Pilot?

Code Pilot is an outlaw collective of seasoned and successful misfits. Founded by Dave Lemphers, Scott Fletcher, Caleb Jones and Cara McCarty, they bring together global experience building world class products at Enterprise companies and startups alike. Dave runs engineering, and was part of the core team that shipped the first release of Windows Azure @ Microsoft, ran Cloud Computing @ PwC, has sold multiple startups, holds 4 patents on data science, and in addition to being a co-founder and CEO @ Code Pilot, also serves as a Program CTO for Techstars.

Responsible for ensuring the business makes better
decisions through collection and usage of data. Ensures business data and
analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including
data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data

markets and the operations of real estate assets.

addresses reporting needs.

information, using judgment and statistical tests.

relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights. Well
versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights
from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other
data representation techniques as required.

issues in cooperation with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work
flows and procedures.

modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve
business performance.

of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (i.e. Tableau Desktop).

judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple
levels of the organization.

Is well versed in data
visualization techniques utilizing Tableau Desktop

Other Duties as Assigned.

No formal supervisory
responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as
technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign

OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Job Description
Data and Analytics professionals define strategies, develop and deliver solutions that enable the collection, processing and management of information from one or more sources, and the subsequent delivery of information to audiences in support of key business processes.
Data Management and Strategic Enablement professionals applies a comprehensive understanding of end-to-end data processes/flows and concepts to implement frameworks, processes, controls, models, and solutions to ensure data is effectively managed across the organization or within a specific business unit. The data enablement manager is responsible for defining business insight through data wrangling, munging, etc. and defining opportunity development across critical data domains (e.g. product, customer, supplier) and incorporation of these insights into client’s business culture. Utilizing capabilities delivered via Business Intelligence and Visualization tools, the candidate will focus on extensive and thorough work in data analysis, data model/architecture, data integration, and especially data science. The candidate will be expected to quickly establish himself/herself as an SME. The candidate will interact with clients at various levels within client’s business functional areas and adjacent functional areas across the enterprise. The candidate will be a key participant on initiatives work, business analysis, data analysis, strategy, asset development, and delivery of solutions.
A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:
Exercises judgment and business acumen in selecting methods and techniques to deliver functional rules on non-routine and very complex aspects of quality control across the enterprise.
Experience manipulating large sets of data and can speak to that data
Conduct data analysis, profiling, mining across disparate data sources to identify gaps and interpret business value impacts while recommending solutions in process and technologies
Translates data requirements into meaningful report deliverables; partners with various teams to drive development, awareness, and adoption of reports.
Provides ongoing oversight of report usage and proactively identifies/implements enhancement opportunities.
Understand and provide guidance in compliance, Banking best practices, KPI development and quality rules
Collects data and performs research to support program leadership.
Performs computations and prepares tabulations and graphs.
Conducts analyses and prepares studies and reports.
Create interactive data visualizations that allow the business leaders to adjust quickly to performance and market trends and make data-driven decisions
Identify potential changes in business and prove / disprove underlying reasons for change using data
Present and deliver valuable insights to sales business leaders
Extract usable information from unstructured data using advanced data mining techniques
Works in very close collaboration with other team mates to ensure consistency across reporting areas and identify cross training opportunities
+ Basic qualifications
Basic Qualifications
Minimum 10 years of experience in data analysis and capture operations
Minimum 3 years of data analysis and analytics across business functional units targeted at business development, process improvement, and competitive insights
Minimum 5 years of business analysis and explore & research trends producing high value KPIs with inference on operational efficiency, system/product upgrades, improvements, and decisive reporting
Minimum 5 years client facing experience and interactions
Preferred Qualifications
Prior team leadership or management experience preferred
Familiarity with statistics, algorithms, and trend research
Bachelor’s Degree and MBA preferred
Professional Skill Requirements
This role requires 100% travel flexibility to travel and work onsite with clients (typically Monday - Thursday)
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

NI is looking to hire an experienced Information Architect and Product Owner to evolve and transform the information assets needed to run an grow the business in line with NI's core strategic vision. This requires a reliable customer-centric view to power enterprise wide strategy, planning and execution as well as provide a blueprint for delivering differentiated customer treatment and experience.

This person will be responsible for understanding the full set of needs for customer data across the enterprise, including working with stakeholders from executive leadership, sales, marketing, finance, and engineering to rationalize their needs into a single prioritized list of capabilities. This role would align various functional groups and guide the priority of IT projects, policies, and governance towards enabling customer information capabilities to support the business.

This person will strengthen the impact of, and provides recommendations on, business information that will need to be available and shared consistently across the organization through the identification, definition and analysis of how information assets aid strategies and business outcomes.

Primary Responsibilities and Activities
Develop a vision for customer information usage throughout the enterprise
Influence information strategy: By partnering with business unit leadership, and through the rationalization of the information value chain, the information architect will provide strategic recommendations to maximize the value of information assets via their creation, access and use. He/she will be responsible for translating business vision and capability requirements into solid data models.
Roadmap Management: Prioritize the backlog of user stories for delivery, based on alignment to the product roadmap. Engage with development teams to ensure business needs are translated into appropriate technical specifications, and acceptance criteria is met
Enable effective data and analytics governance: Ensure integrity of key information assets for the company that are based on customer data and experience. Suggest who can take what actions with what information, and under what circumstances. Assist data and analytics leaders, and business and IT leadership in developing information governance processes and structures.
Conduct business information modeling: Create and manage business information models in all their forms, including conceptual models, relational database designs, message models and others.
Aid efforts to improve business performance through enterprise information solutions and capabilities, such as master data management (MDM), metadata management, analytics, content management, data integration, and related information management or information infrastructure components.
Enable Enterprise Information Management: Ensure that the business and data architecture is used as a lens and a filter to identify, prioritize and execute the data and analytic initiatives with clear line of sight to enterprise strategies and business outcomes.
Surface information priority: Assess the benefits and the risks of information by using tools such as business capability models to create an information-centric view to quickly visualize what information matters most to the organization based on the defined business strategy.
Ideal Background

Candidates should have:
A minimum of ten or more years of experience, with at least three years in information system design.
Considerable experience as Data/Information architect in an Enterprise with significant complexity and proven success
In-depth experience of designing and implementing information solutions.
Hands-on experience with implementing data and analytics management programs is preferred.
Three to five years' experience as a data analyst is highly desirable.
Required Knowledge and Skills
Effective conceptualization, pattern recognition and teaming skills.
Business acumen, and the ability to communicate to executives, business domain stakeholders and technical staff alike.
Demonstrated influence, communication, presentation and facilitation skills.
Experience with innovation and ideation methods, such as design thinking.
Data modeling and information classification expertise at the enterprise level.
Understanding of common information architecture frameworks and information models.
Understanding of metamodels, taxonomies and ontologies, as well as of the challenges of applying structured techniques (data modeling) to less-structured sources.
Familiarity with data science concepts, as well as MDM, business intelligence, and data warehouse design and implementation techniques.
Experience with distributed management and analytics in cloud and hybrid environments.
Strong communication and persuasion skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder needs.
Ability to analyze project, program and portfolio needs, as well as determine the resources needed to achieve objectives and overcome cross-functional barriers.
Key Behaviors and Competencies

Candidates should:
Demonstrate the ability to work well with others and exhibit leadership.
Have a track record of remaining unbiased toward specific technologies or vendors.
Be an excellent communicator and collaborator, engaging with multiple technical and business stakeholders and leaders.
Be able to translate the information architecture contribution to business outcomes into simple briefings for use by various data-and-analytics-related roles.
Ability to communicate, influence and persuade peers and leadership.
Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations.
Ability and desire to work in a lean/agile development environment

SDL2017

Our homes are our most valuable asset and also the most difficult to buy and sell. Knock is on a mission to make trading in your house as simple and certain as trading in your car. Started by founding team members of Trulia.com (NYSE: TRLA, acquired by Zillow for $3.5B), Knock is an online home trade-in platform that uses data science to price homes accurately, technology to sell them quickly and a dedicated team of professionals to guide you every step of the way. We share the same top-tier investors as iconic brands like Netflix, Tivo, Match, HomeAway and Houzz.

We're looking for a full-time local Licensed Agent who excels at exceeding customer expectations. Agents at Knock are part of a revolutionary new way of buying and selling homes. As a Licensed Local Expert at Knock, you won't spend a minute cold-calling, door-knocking, or direct-mailing. You'll have plenty of leads, mostly generated from our awesome marketing, and you'll be working as a full-time employee with a salary, benefits and uncapped commissions.

Requirements and Responsibilities:
Passionate: You must be excited about evangelizing a new way of buying and selling homes, as prepared to exceed the expectations of all buyers and sellers with whom you work.
Team-player: In addition to buying and selling houses, you're expected to be a subject matter expert and will have an opportunity to shape the evolution of our business.
Closer: You'll convert leads into contracts and contracts into sales! With leads coming in daily, you'll have plenty of opportunities for success and you'll have a team of Knockstars to assist you throughout the entire process.
Must-have Skills:
You're an experienced Licensed Agent (aka agent) who knows the intricacies of the local neighborhoods, schools and real estate trends.
Competitive edge: You love to win and hate to lose. You're excited to help Knock revolutionize the home selling and buying experience.
Real estate chops: You have years of experience negotiating and closing real estate transactions, and, per online reviews, you are a responsive, professional and knowledgeable agent.
Tech-savvy: You are able to use and adapt to new technology quickly.
Intelligent: You are articulate and have great written and verbal communication skills.
Knock Agent Advantages:
Knock can serve both buyers and sellers in an innovative way - We can buy our client's new house for them or we can guarantee the sale of the house they are looking to sell.
Knock does the Prep - We are the only company that invests its own money into the house to get it show ready, which gives Knock agents even more of an advantage over traditional agents. Homeowners dread dealing with contractors and getting their house ready to list. We manage and pay for improvements that maximize offers. The homeowners gets all the upside from our investment and then we settle with the homeowner for our cost of those improvements at closing - we pass our volume discounted cost directly to the seller.
Knock does all the marketing - Our listing agents never spend a dime on marketing themselves on Knock properties. Knock will generate 100% of buyers and sellers through PR, advertising online, radio and TV. Knock also pays for all marketing and advertising of properties, including professional photos, an immersive virtual reality tour, aerial videos, placement in the local MLS, plenty of signage and paid promotion on sites like Zillow, Trulia, Realtor.com, Facebook and Google.
You have an entire support team - As a Knock agent, all you have to do is help us price houses, get listing agreements signed and help make/negotiate offers. The support team will do the rest. You have a team of home valuation specialists that help you price homes scientifically, a team of customer success specialists who manage all the sales admin, a team of home prep specialists who inspect, prep and show the houses, and a team of transaction coordinators who do everything once a house is under contract and all the way through to closing.
Benefits - This is an amazing opportunity to be an integral part of building a consumer brand from scratch in an industry that is long overdue for a new way of doing things. You will be working with a team that believes in the power of data and analytical decision making with a desire to disrupt the status quo. We offer competitive cash and equity compensation, full medical, dental, vision benefits, 401k, unlimited vacation (2 weeks mandatory) and sick time.
Please no recruitment firm or agency inquiries, you will not receive a reply from us.

Job Description
IBM is looking for high caliber individuals to join our Cognitive Process Services (CPS) business, as a F & A Solution Architect.

CPS combines process, people, and technology transformation with an outsourced delivery model to create significant client business value across the front and back office. Our solutions provide services to clients leveraging automation, AI and data science digital assets that result in value far beyond traditional labor arbitrage

Solution Architects are responsible for generating high levels of client satisfaction by developing proposals for client pain points in both Request for Proposal (RFP) format and non-RFP format. In both formats, Solution Architects will be expected to interact with clients at CXO level and with the clients appointed Third Party Advisor, where applicable, to shape and present the most appropriate solution for the client problem that differentiates IBM from its competitors.

As part of proposal development, Solution Architects will be responsible for leading and designing CPS
F & A solutions for existing or prospective IBM clients, working closely with the appointed IBM Sales Lead. In this capacity, Solution Architects will often manage ad-hoc solution/proposal teams, bringing together experience from across the different areas of the IBM business. The role is hands-on and requires a personal contribution to the detailed design of the proposed solutions, particularly with respect to the solution elements requiring expertise in the following areas: F & A processes; Shared Services best practice; IT enablers, F & A digital transformation and transition of work from clients to IBM delivery centers around the world.

We also seek specialist skills and experience in the key industry sectors of Financial Services, Communications, Distribution, and Industrials to provide tailored industry solutions.

Solution Architects will be expected to share the knowledge and experience gained on every assignment with other members of the F & A Solutions Practice (e.g. through posting of proposal and solution materials to shared data repositories).

Solution development covers the following areas:
Scope definition and alignment to the win strategy themes as agreed with the Sales leads.
Lead client discovery sessions / workshops, mutual value discovery and yellow pads, orals
Definition of the proposed service delivery model and Target Operating Model (including benchmarks, governance, delivery organization design, process re-design, and IT solution design etc.)
Writing of the solution proposal and presentations for senior level client stakeholders
Understanding of all technology assets and ability to select the right assets for each client and design the right architecture; this includes the ability to work with Technical Architects to put forward a best in class architecture for the digitally enabled BPO solution.

Title Senior Product Owner
Organization Name Macmillan Learning
City Austin
State TX
Description Macmillan Learning is a part of the family-owned Holtzbrinck group of companies and is one of the leading educational technology companies. Through deep partnership with the world's best researchers, educators, administrators, and developers, we facilitate
teaching and learning opportunities that spark student engagement and improve outcomes. We provide educators with tailored solutions designed to inspire student curiosity and measure progress. Macmillan Learning is comprised of renowned brands including Bedford/St.
Martins, W.H. Freeman, Worth Publishers, Sapling Learning, SkyFactor, Intellus Learning, Late Nite Labs, and Hayden-McNeil. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to reflecting a broad representation of differences -- race, ethnicity, religion, sex,
sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, physical ability, age, family status, economic background and status, geographical background and status, and perspective-- in our workplace. The successful candidate for this position will become an employee
of Bedford Freeman & Worth Publishing Group, LLC (“BFW”), d/b/a Macmillan Learning. Bedford Freeman & Worth Publishing Group, LLC has developed an affirmative action program in compliance with the NY Department of Education’s guidance. Portions of the affirmative
action program are available for review by applicants and employees by contacting Human Resources.
Requirements The Senior Product Owner for Data and Analytics will be responsible for helping to improve student learning outcomes and enhancing instructor capabilities in Macmillan’s digital learning tools, by building intuitive and empowering instructor- and student-facing
dashboards that enable remediation and intervention opportunities that will have a measurable impact on student success. This person will work with a cross-functional team of UX designers, learning researchers, learning analytics, product owners, engineers,
and stakeholders, to shepherd ideas through discovery, design, development, and market release/support.

Job Responsibilities
Create and evangelize a vision that delivers research-based, valuable, usable, and actionable data insights for instructors and students within their digital learning products, at the portfolio and product level.
Develop a product roadmap that offers competitive difference and user delight, by helping students and instructors use data to inform their day-to-day learning activities.
Work collaboratively with our Learning Science department, to build a vision based on solid learning research, and our Learning Analytics team, to incorporate reliable and novel metrics, while delivering the best capabilities we can for our users.
Lead discovery research efforts directly with current and prospective users, gathering feedback and insights that help drive the vision and roadmap.
Develop cross-functional teams that help deliver and prove the value they create for their customers.
Measure and present the impact of your team’s work directly to the leadership team, quantifying the value of your progress.
Be a thought leader around customer use of analytics.
Required Skills & Qualifications
5+ years’ experience in software product management with 10+ years’ overall work experience.
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, Data Science) or equivalent experience
3+ years experience building, delivering, and supporting customer-facing data visualization, services, and/or products
Experience using data to inform design and product decisions
Experience creating products that exploit data to facilitate decision making, including data visualization outputs within a product
Strong presentation skills used for presenting internally to leadership team members as well as running customer discovery sessions such as user groups and product demos
Excellent time management skills and able to manage deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Enjoy adapting to feedback from both users and internal stakeholders, building stronger products as a result
Strong leadership skills to ensure that everyone is driving towards the product goals together, and is bought-in to your vision
Experience working with a Data Science or Analytics team a plus
Experience in and a passion for education - in EdTech, teaching, or another role is a significant plus
The ideal candidate is/has...
Ability to assess customer needs and translate them into product requirements.
Confidence to champion ideas and solutions and raise issues across the organization.
Customer-first sensibility and passion for ensuring their success.
Thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Enjoys working in teams.
Willingness to travel as needed and occasionally be accessible by phone during off-hours to help resolve customer or partner issues.
Has a passion for education and is eager to continually learn about the customers we serve (customers and students)

Job Description
IBM is looking for high caliber individuals to join our Cognitive Process Services (CPS) business, as a Procurement Solution Architect.

CPS combines process, people, and technology transformation with an outsourced delivery model to create significant client business value across the front and back office. Our solutions provide services to clients leveraging automation, AI and data science digital assets that result in value far beyond traditional labor arbitrage

Solution Architects are responsible for generating high levels of client satisfaction by developing proposals for client pain points in both Request for Proposal (RFP) format and non-RFP format. In both formats, Solution Architects will be expected to interact with clients at CXO level and with the clients appointed Third Party Advisor, where applicable, to shape and present the most appropriate solution for the client problem that differentiates IBM from its competitors.

As part of proposal development, Solution Architects will be responsible for leading and designing CPS
Procurement solutions for existing or prospective IBM clients, working closely with the appointed IBM Sales Lead. In this capacity, Solution Architects will often manage ad-hoc solution/proposal teams, bringing together experience from across the different areas of the IBM business. The role is hands-on and requires a personal contribution to the detailed design of the proposed solutions, particularly with respect to the solution elements requiring expertise in the following areas: Procurement processes; Shared Services best practice; IT enablers, Procurement digital transformation and transition of work from clients to IBM delivery centers around the world.

We also seek specialist skills and experience in the key industry sectors of Financial Services, Communications, Distribution, and Industrials to provide tailored industry solutions.

Solution Architects will be expected to share the knowledge and experience gained on every assignment with other members of the Procurement Solutions Practice (e.g. through posting of proposal and solution materials to shared data repositories).

Solution development covers the following areas:
Scope definition and alignment to the win strategy themes as agreed with the Sales leads.
Lead client discovery sessions / workshops, mutual value discovery and yellow pads, orals
Definition of the proposed service delivery model and Target Operating Model (including benchmarks, governance, delivery organization design, process re-design, and IT solution design etc.)
Writing of the solution proposal and presentations for senior level client stakeholders
Understanding of all technology assets and ability to select the right assets for each client and design the right architecture; this includes the ability to work with Technical Architects to put forward a best in class architecture for the digitally enabled BPO solution.
Oversee response process (delivery input on service levels and statement of work, Legal's input on commercials, challenge responses, process subject matter experts content, technology / tools input)

Site visits - prepare delivery, participate in visits
Lead reviews (pre-solution review, solution review with other geographies, Process owner reviews, global solution reviews (cost sign off)
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Excellent client facing skills (in particular the ability to clearly articulate the value and rationale of the proposed solution in written, presentation and oral formats)
Consulting or Shared Services/ Business Process Outsourcing experience at a senior level in the Procurement arena with a focus on Transformation, with demonstrable improvements in process redesign
Ability to build lasting relationships with clients at Executive level a trusted partner

Purpose of JobUSAAs 10-week, summer internship program offers college students the chance to discover what its like to work at a Fortune 100 company and leading financial services organization. While gaining insight into the service of the military community and USAAs noble mission, interns are immediately part of USAAs collaborative culture. Spend your summer at USAA and gain a career where you can make a difference!

Assists with the development and implementation of solutions to influence business decisions for relevant CoSA or line(s) of business. Assists with the development of best in practice solutions to business challenges. Helps to Identify opportunities to change, enhance, or streamline exiting business programs. Acts as a functional resource to assure proper compliance with processes and regulatory requirements.

Potential placement areas include: Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance, Investments, Banking, Enterprise Business Solutions, Sales & Service Strategy, Project Management, Process Excellence and Relationship Management.Job Requirements

Tasks:

Identifies opportunities and/or implements business solutions to meet business needs.
Researches, plans, develops, implements, and administers rules, requirements, procedures, contracts, and processes to ensure compliance, product competitiveness, profitable growth and adherence to USAA's commitment to being World Class.
Collaborates with enterprise partners to facilitate the development of business rules, requirements and artifacts.
Develops test strategies and criteria, and assists with test execution, defect prioritization and resolution.
Coordinates with appropriate stakeholders and program/project sponsors to help ensure successful product & initiative implementation.
Supports the facilitation of training, communications and related activities.

Job Description
Engage3 is looking for an analytical, data-driven, and operationally experienced on-site Account Manager to partner with one of our Strategic Accounts to help them benefit from our software and analytics solutions. This position will be working out of our client’s office in Austin, Texas with periodic travel to our California headquarters and to the client’s regional offices around the U.S. (~95%+ Austin, ~5% travel).

The Account Manager’s responsibilities include embedding themselves within the customer’s organization to maximize the value derived from our solutions. You will develop relationships across the organization, liaise between the customer’s business challenges and Engage3’s cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions, inform our product roadmap, and provide strategic guidance to the customer.

You will be responsible for overall account & project management. Our ideal candidate is able to anticipate customer needs and exceed client expectations.

Responsibilities:
Further develop and enhance our relationship with our strategic customer and other relevant partners & vendors
Identify and deliver key insights from data and visualizations within Engage3’s solutions
Partner with Engage3’s operations, product management, and data teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives
Project management and process improvement responsibilities
Develop & execute plans to improve Program KPI’s on a continuous basis
Present proposals for new projects and subscriptions
Collaborate with product management team to help inform the company’s product roadmap
Qualifications:
Proven work experience in customer-facing roles
Analytical mindset with a passion for data
Advanced communication skills (written & oral)
Experience with project management and working with remote employees
Ability to drive team meetings with a clear scope, focus and detail
Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level
Solid experience with MS Excel
Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail
3-10+ years experience
BA/BS degree

Company Description
Engage3 helps retailers and brands enhance their pricing performance through data science and analytics. We work with grocery, drug, pet, mass, sporting goods, and e-commerce retailers across the US and Canada to provide localized competitive intelligence, understand their competitors' pricing & assortment strategies, and execute more thoughtful pricing strategies through a combination of big data, predictive analytics, and SaaS solutions.

We were recently announced as one of Inc. Magazine's top 1,500 fastest growing private companies in the US. This recognition comes on the heels of our $12 million Series B financing from retail technology focused venture capitalists.

Our Founders are serial entrepreneurs - their first company, KhiMetrics, is credited with creating the retail price optimization industry and was ultimately acquired by SAP in 2006. Now we're targeting a larger opportunity.

We've grown our team by over 50% in the last year and have been focused on bringing on passionate & smart teammates who take pride in their work and are looking to make a difference.

If this sounds like you, let's talk.

Description

Primary responsibilities of the Sr. Architect Lead Analyst - Salesforce include working with stakeholders across the North Americal Global Consumer business and technology functions including Branded Cards, Retail Bank, Private Label Cards, Mortgage, and Commercial Bank to envision, design, develop and deploy the technical solution leveragin Salesforce for any and all systems projects.

Deliverables are aligned to goals as follows:

- Lead the Initial and continuing design functions for Salesforce related projects of any size and complexity in a multi Salesforce Org environment, including, but not limited to Application Solutions Architecture, Integration Architecture, Data Architecture, Tech Stack Selection and Security Architecture

- Provide strong leadership for technical design functions on assigned projects, Proofs of Concept, feasibility studies, roadmap development and strategies.

- Provide the business with strong direction in the establishment of investment budgets and strategies

- Create Architecture Design Charters for architecturally significant projects leveraging deep knowledge of new products / 3rd party external services and significant re-engineering of existing systems. Present the proposed architecture to senior sponsors and approvers. Review designs according the SDLC milestones to ensure adoption of the approved architecture.

- Lead key elements of the development of the NA Citicorp Roadmap by providing line-of-business (LOB) specific updates on planned/funded technology initiatives.

- Review assigned projects on the LOB release plan-of-record for architectural significance and level of engagement, and be able to translate the non-functional requirements into volumetrics for systems capacity analysis.

- Drive reuse of common services defined by the Global Consumer Technology Reference Architecture.

Qualifications

A minimum of 10 years of experience in the field of Information Technology including positions in development, systems administration, and architecture. Possess a high level of competency in the following areas.

Certified Technical Architect (CTA) Certification

Strong depth in all the Salesforce related technology skillset areas listed below and a broad understanding all of the rest.

Ability to lead stakeholders across the organization at all levels to consensus in asserting an architecture which aligns the business objectives with GCT strategy.

Knowledge of Financial services systems, particularly Lead, Prospect and Customer Management, Offer Management, Originations and Servicing.

An understanding of innovation in the IT and financial industries

Directs hands-on architecture design participation on large, complex projects

Execution of governance in the adoption of standards through defined processes

Architecture -

- Extensive hands-on experience integrating the Salesforce Financial Services Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Einstein with large-scale financial services legacy applications.

- Demonstrable practical experience in architecture roles within a complex enterprise environment including assisting in setting architectural principles, helping define the reference architecture, building technology roadmaps aligned with business plans and helping to institute governance to ensure alignment of investment to strategy/architecture.

- Strongly developed strategic, analytical and communication skills evidenced by experience in formulating strategic scenarios, evaluating trade-offs within a robust commercial framework, developing related financial models and designing practical execution plans.

- Experience with JSON/RESTful APIs and Java Springboot micro-services deployed to platform as a service (PaaS) cloud [Pivotal Cloud Foundry, OpenShift and/or equivalent].

- An understanding of, and ideally experience with external cloud hosting providers including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and IBM Bluemix

- Extremely strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage one-on-one at all levels of the organization or present to business and technical stakeholders.

- Technical aptitude and experience across a wide range of platforms (refer to Technical Skillset section)

- A deep understanding of software delivery including traditional process driven waterfall, agile and variances of each.

- A demonstrated ability to work within a team and build consensus towards a technical direction

- IT delivery experience involving infrastructure and applications through concept, development, validation, deployment, and support

- Product evaluation through RFI/RFP including working with vendors and internal stakeholder groups to align features, technology, and cost to meeting the business objectives.

- Strong technical expertise, ability to execute proofs of concept, effectively partnering with Technical leads in Development organizations.

Technology (and tools)

- Salesforce CTA certification is required, with particularly deep expertise in the Platform App Builder, Platform Developer, Data Architecture and Management Designer and Integraton Arhcitecture domains

- Expertise creating and integrating Salesforce External Services, External Objects and use of Salesforce Connect using OData with internal APIs and microservices

- Salesforce Visualforce, Apex, SOQL/SOSL,

- API and micorservice development integrating both internally and externally services and platforms

- Salesforce Database.com (assumed with CTA certificaiton and Data Domain expertise)

- Wave Analytics

- Einstein Analytics

- BI/analytics technologies including Salesforce Einstein, SAS, R, Teradata, Hadoop, data science and visualization tools

- Integration technologies for middleware and enterprise service bus (ESB) including Tibco BusinessWorks / EMS, and message protocols/formats (JMS, MQ, SOAP, JSON, XML).

- Business Process, Rules, and Event Management systems including Tibco AMX BPM and FICO Blaze

- Security concepts and technologies related to authentication (MFA, risk based authentication, biometrics, SAML/OAUTH), authorization, encryption, data protection, threat prevention, and S-SDLC best practices including one-time-password (OTP), SSL, PKI, DDoS remediation, anti-malware detection, and application scanning.

- Voice platforms including NICE auto-dialer/recording, Voice-activated devices, IVR/ACD, VOIP, soft-phone client and integration.

- Cross-channel servicing application frameworks including contact center (native Java framework, Chordiant, Pega), internet/mobile/tablet (HTML5).

- Technical architecture and development experience with JSON/RESTful APIs and Java Springboot micro-services deployed to platform as a service (PaaS) cloud [Pivotal Cloud Foundry].

- Experience in digital marketing including the full lifecycle from Big Data Analytics and model development to real-time omni-channel decision services based on the Hadoop tech stack, Spark, H2O, Apache BRMS, and 3rd party Data Management / Data Service Platforms.

Non-technology

- Influencing skills and preferred experience working across many areas and levels of an organization

- Strong understanding of Retail and/or Commercial Banking business functions

- Governance to IT Strategies, Roadmaps, Application Portfolio Management, Technology Standards Management.

- Process optimization, standardization, and implementation

- Good communication and collaboration skill

Job Description
Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or providing nurses to educate patients or prescribers. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
 
We are excited to announce that at this time we are looking for a Nurse Educator (Ambassador) to join our team of over 10,000 global field personnel supporting our pharmaceutical and biotech clients.
 
 Nurse Educator (Ambassador)
 
Patients are at the center of our business strategies. The Ambassador Program is an educational based program designed as a resource for patients living with HCV (Hepatitis C Virus) that have been prescribed specific medications. Ambassadors provide education about specific disease treatments and resources to empower patients to understand and manage their disease state. Ambassadors are responsible for participating in one-on-one communications with patients as well as appropriate medical professionals within the associated treatment process. Since the program is strictly educational based, Ambassadors do not provide medical advice or work clinically within this role.
 
The Ambassador will:
Coordinate and facilitate the connection between patients and program approved, patient based resources.
Provide direct educational training to patients on HCV and assigned medication.
Provide patient-focused education to promote behavioral change for the empowerment of patients to improve specific treatment compliance
Foster appropriate dialogue between patient and health care provider
 
IQVIA offers a friendly, progressive work atmosphere and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance and vision coverage, tuition assistance, bonus plan and 401(k).
 
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
 
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.
 
Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!
 
We invite you to join IQVIA™.
 
We look forward to the prospect of working with you! Please apply on-line at: www.IQVIA.com

Who we are:

We are Code Pilot, a data science company with the mission to change the hiring process. An engineer should be judged on their talent which is why we created Code Pilot portfolio. An intelligent platform where you showcase, validate, and share your skills with hiring managers in real-time. There is no need for a resume, cover letter, phone screen, or technical interview when you build a Code Pilot portfolio. Let your code do the talking.

We are looking for:

A new team member to support the development of a platform for one of our hiring partners. In order to be eligible, please build your Code Pilot portfolio at https://portfolio.mycodepilot.com

Do you want to build your brand by working for an up and coming startup that is changing the landscape of employment opportunities for fellow software engineers? Are you interested in leveraging your DevOps skills and technical abilities to improve mission execution? If so, we could be the place for you! Company Description
J Halton Group LLC- Executive Search

Mission

Who We Are

Founded and continuously led by inventor and entrepreneur Tony Aquila, Solera is a global leader in digital technologies that connect and secure life's most important assets: our cars, homes and identities. Since its inception in 2005 as a garage-based startup, Solera has grown aggressively with over 50 acquisitions across its platforms. The company's current product solutions include Audatex, Autodata, AutoPoint, CAP/HPI, Colimbra, Digidentity, Enservio, Explore Data, Hollander, Identifix, Inpart, LYNX and TitleTec, as well as the company's flagship Digital Garage application. Today, Solera processes over 300 million transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in over 80 countries. Unified by a strong culture that values uncommon entrepreneurial thinking and continuous "do-it-different" innovation, Solera's global workforce of 6,700+ associates come from diverse forward-thinking industries that include automotive technology, artificial intelligence, software development, data sciences, cybersecurity, cognitive design, and digital identity protection. For more information, please visit solera.com.

The Solera Way

Solera’s uncommon culture is based on three simple principles: Think 80/20 (Focus), Act 30/30 (Efficiency), and Live 90/10 (Accountability). We define our mindset using Our 3H’s: Humility, a Hunger to succeed, and a desire to Hunt for opportunities to win. We train our volunteers to engage with each other modulating between their intellect (IQ) and emotional intelligence (EQ) using our 3Fs: Facts, Finesse, and Force. Solera has become a global technology leader that is constantly growing in the double digits. The principles, drills, and values associated with the Solera Way have been fundamental to Solera’s success and our ability to grow, continuously change, and innovate.

Are You Uncommon?

We’re on the hunt for an experienced Research Data Analyst who ranks in the top quartile among their peers. Someone who has a highly competitive and entrepreneurial mindset that is wired with a team-first attitude, has no problem rolling up their sleeves to execute their missions, and can modulate between leading and following as needed. You will serve as a Business Analyst within the RFR (Request For Review) department.

Position 80s

What You’ll Be Doing

At Solera, we believe in providing clarity and focus to what our volunteers are responsible for – their mission. The 80’s, as we call them at Solera, are the employee’s priorities associated with their role or mission. The mission 80’s for this role, are:
Internal and External Client Support including but not limited to chat, email, and face to face interaction to ensure client satisfaction
Drive Improvement in all associated Solera products through 30/30 opportunity recognition as well as cross-functional collaboration with peers.
Employ a 90/10 attitude by taking ownership of additional projects (20’s) as necessary to exceed project objectives.
Additional responsibilities of the role include:
Analyze internal and external system inquiries and create/open tickets in the tracker system.
Research solutions, then create and attach inquiry data packages to all tickets while ensuring the requests are clear and concise for data technicians in order to solve them.
Close tickets in a timely fashion and directly communicate all resolution outcomes to customers via emailed resolution letters.
Follow the product release schedule and contribute to monthly release timeline fulfilment.
Provide technical support to the Tier 1 level helpdesk when necessary via live chat, email, and/or phone.
Maintain the highest degree of customer satisfaction by fostering clear, professional communication and exceeding client expectations.
Active participation and collaboration with fellow GDC team members on different projects and industry relations activities.
Provide input for the preparation of plans and forecasts.
Analyze data output reports and initiate both preventive and corrective actions.
Participation in Ownership of DBRM (Database Reference Manual) Updates.
Qualifications

Are You Qualified?
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent technical training in the Automotive Industry
3+ years using collision estimating software (Knowledge of Audatex and/or Autosource is a plus)
3+ years of Insurance or Collision Repair Facility work experience
Personal Lines claims process knowledge
Technical writing skills utilizing proper grammar, spelling, etc.
Excellent communication skills, including application of conflict negotiation strategies
Proficiency with common Microsoft utilities such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Any relative experience commensurate with items listed above


Our Space

We believe that offices should be destinations where people want to be… places where people want to work, play and, collaborate. That is why we spend a lot of time on enhancing our workspaces. Solera’s work environments are intersections of the old and the new… of the past, present, and future. They are spaces designed to stimulate creative thinking, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration.

We also embrace wellness. Whether it is our onsite or offsite workout centers, nutritional meals and beverages, or endless snacks for focus and energy. This wellness plan is our commitment to healthy living, which spans across our office environments.

Click here to learn more on Global Data & Content: www.soleragdc.com

Division Information

Spectrum Brands – Pet, Home & Garden, based in St. Louis, Missouri, is a leading supplier of well-recognized consumer products globally for the pet supply markets, and nationally for the home, lawn and garden insect and weed control markets. The company delivers innovative products of outstanding quality for the pet owners of dogs, cats, birds, small animals, fish and reptiles. The company also delivers groundbreaking products of exceptional value and top-notch quality, so consumers benefit from insect and weed control solutions. The Home & Garden brands — Spectracide®, Garden Safe®, Hot Shot®, Cutter®, Repel®, Black Flag® and Liquid Fence® — and the Pet Brands — Tetra®, Instant Ocean®, Marineland®, 8-in-1®, Dingo®, FURminator®, Nature’s Miracle®, GloFish®, DreamBone® and SmartBones® — are well-recognized by consumers for delivering exceptional value and trusted results.

Job Summary

An analytical, process oriented individual will be placed on the Omni-Channel PHG team to directly engage with multiple retailers and internal teams to analyze the impact of a dynamic marketplace. The Pricing Economics Analyst must apply a wide range of KSAs to work across key areas such as data analytics, sales, marketing, supply chain, revenue management, consumer insights, trade marketing, and finance to optimize the Omni-channel performance of our products.

Provide weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual updates across all key retailers; this includes integrating into existing business reviews.

Lead semi-annual benchmarking activities
Develop benchmarking measurements, participants, and reporting to ensure that our products continue to provide best in class value to consumers.
Develop pilots and Test and Learns:
Identify gaps in our current plans and develop pilots and test and learns to close the gaps.
Influence Omni-Channel Strategy:
This role will recommend enhancements to existing plans as well as develop nascent strategies to grow market segment share.

Support (20%)
Assist in developing consumer insights:
Integrate with our brand/marketing team to aggregate consumer and retailer insights to develop new insights into shopping behavior.

Prior experience with regression analysis, senior level presentation, results organization, and elasticity analysis is preferred

Overview
This is an opportunity to be a key member of Bain's expanding advanced analytics capability area. This position will be part of the Advanced Analytics Group (Bain's team of Operations Research, Data Science, Engineering, Marketing Science and Primary research experts).
The role will focus on applying demand forecasting and sales&operations planning to address clients' business problems; providing expertise in forecasting and other operations research techniques within the Advanced Analytics Group; and coaching client-facing consultants on implementation, interpretation, and communication of forecasting solutions.
This person can be located in LA, SF, Boston, Dallas, Chicago or Atlanta
Responsibilities
Scope and identify opportunities to improve client forecast models through better data and information, better assumptions and inputs, better algorithms and forecast methods, and better use of existing planning/forecasting systems
Execute data queries and data engineering to identify opportunities and prepare to build forecasts using a variety of data sources including sales, promotion, marketing, economic, weather and other data.
Build forecast models using a variety of methods, including statistical, consensus and collaborative, and machine learning approaches and guide putting these models into production inside client systems
Generate insights on demand drivers and opportunities to improve forecast and planning processes.
Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations.
Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate use of algorithms by clients in day-to-day business operations after Bain projects end
Train and coach consultants on basic forecasting procedures. Assist in knowledge transfer and deployment with end-clients
Train and coach other AAG colleagues on skills, processes and tools required to support forecasting and other operations research work
Stay abreast of developments in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients
The person in this role will need the ability to:
Communicate effectively with analytics/data experts, Bain consulting teams, client business leaders and executives of all levels to assess opportunities and develop analytics solutions for Bain clients
Translate business objectives into data and analytics solutions using appropriate methodologies
Design, execute and direct demand forecasting, sales&operations planning, and other operations research projects
Think creatively and adapt to novel applications and new business contexts
Qualifications
Experience building forecasts for a variety of business applications including forecasts to support strategic initiatives, planning, demand shaping, daily baseline models.
Experience with building forecasts for a variety of contexts, e.g. service demand, sales and operations planning, inventory, and econometric forecasts
Expertise using a wide range of statistical forecasting methodologies: ARIMA and related time series, causal/structural, consensus, traditional and ensemble techniques
Experience with applications of machine learning techniques to forecasting, e.g. Gradient Boosting Machines, Neural Nets, Bayesian methods, etc.
Familiar with working with data from ERP systems, enterprise planning and forecasting systems, and cloud based forecasting and planning tools; ideal candidate will have experience on where can automate forecasting process and how to best enable human-in-the-loop processes
Experience working with internal sources and suppliers (backward, upstream) and customers (forward, downstream) to improve forecasts
Strong data engineering and data science skills.
Master's degree or higher in a related discipline such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, quantitative Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong skills in scoping, problem definition and problem solving under time constraints
Must thrive in a fast paced environment and be able to work independently
50% travel is likely
Nice to have
Knowledge and experience applying demand forecasting in a services context (e.g., airline yield management, field scheduling&routing)
Experience with a broader range of operations research applications (e.g. predictive maintenance, supply chain analytics, simulation and optimization)
Experience with a variety of statistical, modelling and data analytics tools, e.g. SAS, SAS/OR, SPSS, R, Python, SQL, ORACLE etc.
Familiarity with enterprise forecasting systems (e.g., Oracle Demantra, JDA Demand planning, SAS Forecaster)
Experience with VBA and SAS/OR. Optional experience with C, C++, Java.
