*Global Services Digital Platform**
*Data Curator/Engineer**
The Digital Platform team is a key component of VMware?s support organization that provides an enriched and valuable ecosystem of data and analytics that drive innovation for our customers and support engineers globally. Data is the most valuable asset in VMware and we're dedicated to develop data pipelines for helping our customers.
*Position Summary:**
VMware is seeking a Data Curator/Engineer to enable the data science and machine learning teams. The position works with the Senior Manager, Digital Platform Architecture.

The data curation role will ?own? the data that we require to deliver predictive and proactive support and services. You will help harmonize incoming data from major sources including Skyline (a real-time feed of customer data center topology, configuration, and events), VMware SaaS products, and improve these feeds with user behaviour and profile information to deliver next-generation support. It involves curating data for different analytical tasks, to plan resources for accelerating data analysis, to add semantic meaning to a data catalog, to blend data sets together, and to organize project areas for teams of data analysts and data scientists to work together more effectively.

Your major areas of focus will help enable: the ?self-driving data center,? ?faster forensics? for our support teams, and the data for our ?personalized platform.?

You will be responsible for lending understanding to the huge amounts of data that will drive our next-generation customer support experience.
*Primary responsibilities include:**
+ Provide thought leadership for harmonizing data across multiple business units and products. For example, from telemetry feeds of many VMware products, provide a single view of a customer without duplicating data.

+ Provide ownership of all data ?types? that are involved in providing an amazing customer experience ? advise product managers on potential high-value uses of available data about a customer environment or specific support users.

+ Maintaining the data catalog/dictionary of all inbound data to prevent duplication of data types and to enable data analysis with the right context. The dictionary will be used across many product units and development teams.

+ Ensure data is in a format that's consumable for feature-extraction for machine learning and data science (streaming and batch analytics)

+ You will be involved in proof-of-concept projects to build proven value from the ingested data.
*Key Responsibilities include:**
+ Drive internal proof of concept initiatives. When needed, quickly design and implement a prototype that can be shown to internal product or platform teams. This would include hands-on coding to extract or manipulate data as required.

+ Establish relationships with key architects across technology organizations and collaborate on harmonizing data and data pipelines.

+ Work with the CMBU (Cloud Management Business Unit) to drive toward the ?self-driving data center.?

+ Standardizing metadata is hard, but you?ll fix that.
*Qualifications**
+ Experienced with a minimum of 5+ years in data engineering

+ Integration level design/coding experience/skills using Python, R, Java/Scala.

+ Familiar with TensorFlow, Keras, Torch and designing pipelines for these.

+ Familiar with data at scale

+ SQL/noSQL technology

+ Familiar with Database, ETL and BI technologies

+ Strong at technical goal setting for a project with actionable success metrics. Good knowledge and experience on measuring a service from user experience angle.

+ Strong at identifying problems, solving complex problems with simple solutions.

+ Think strategically: See patterns and relationships in information and events; clarify and simplify complex information; anticipate trends and possibilities that may lead to new business opportunities; consistently think and act ?ahead of the curve;? anticipate and effectively respond with urgency to immediate opportunities; executes plans vigorously and with flexibility; operate actively; identify and address long-term opportunities.

+ Strong on working towards results and self-motivated, strong learning mindset, with deep understanding of related advanced/new technology. Keep up with the technology development in the related areas in the industry.

+ Good verbal, written, presentation, facilitation, and interaction skills, including ability to effectively communicate architectural issues and concepts to multiple organization levels and executive management.

Job Summary: As a Data Architect, you will work with the business and technical teams to define the BI or analytics solutions needed to meet the short term and long term business objective. You will be responsible for architecting the data flow, data integration patterns, logical and physical data models, define new data standards, and define and design integrations to and from our analytical environments (Hadoop, Reporting Cubes, Complex Event Processing, EDW, and specialized data marts). DATASCI3232

HEAD FOR BUSINESS - Ability to leverage your technical expertise and business process knowledge to help define, design and implement great solutions across many lines of business (Supply Chain, Transportation, Rx, Store Merchandising, Purchasing, Inventory Management, e-Commerce, Customer Analytics, Accounting, Loss Prevention, and much more)?
HEART FOR PEOPLE - Willingness to share your experience and knowledge while working on many different teams?
PASSION FOR RESULTS - Adaptability and innovation, with a strong eye for the possible and an ear for the business problem?
You should have:

- 5-8 Years of deep experience with designing and scaling data
- Experience with cloud native, microservices oriented, and big data/non-relational data architectures.
- Experience in OLTP, OLAP, and unstructured data across numerous data platforms
- Track record for listening to many points of view, ask clarifying questions, and can lead a group to design the best solutions
- A proven ability to pivot as business clarity is defined
- Extremely strong analytical and problem solving skills
- CS degree, Bachelors in Information Systems, or proven experience
What is the work? (other duties may be assigned as necessary)
Data Design:

- Follow the data: Design data flows and define integration and transformation patterns from data creation into end points.
- Understand the business: Work with the IT and business teams to define the business opportunity and associated business processes and systems.
- Balance the long-term and short-term: Design and anticipate for the long term while delivering value back to the business as quickly as possible.
- Design for scalability: For our DW environment, able to define and design proper usage columnar datasets vs standard relational datasets.
- Enterprise data design: Proven experience in advanced data modeling and data modeling within an enterprise data warehouse.
- Analytical modeling: Able to work with data science and data analytic teams to understand the required inputs and outputs into various statistical models.
- Technology selection: Select technologies that meet the business and organizational objectives to fulfill the business objectives.
- Physical environments: Has a strong understanding of the physical environment, constraints, and available options. Is able to make advanced recommendations when expansions may be needed.
Teamwork and Mentorship:

- Business process understanding: Able to work with business teams to learn and refine the business opportunities. This individual should be a person who seeks clarity in order to make a good business recommendation, and then refine that recommendation with more input.
- Technical thought leadership: As a technical thought leader, you will be responsible for recommending and vetting new data technologies.
- Training data engineering staff: Work with data development teams to improve usage of tools and data processing techniques. Able to get into the details in order to find technical design gaps, tool gaps, or implementation opportunities.
- Implementation Verification: An energetic person to follow their recommendations into production. You should be willing to verify and validate the application teams implemented your collective solutions effectively and accurately.
- Broad architectural consideration: Able to gather and implement feedback from other application, security, and data architects.
Communication and Learning:

- Concise written communication: Able to remove excess noise from written technical communication to effectively give development code ready architectural design models and documents.
- Be the question: Able to humbly ask questions when tasked with business challenges that you have limited familiarity.
- Head for the situation: Able to decipher various business situations to know when to go deep with a technological recommendation or when to focus on the process of the solution.
- Constant learner: Proven track record of being a student of the business and an eye to understand technology. Able to develop an opinion on the forces in technology today and which should be considered as best of breed in their space, and which are too early to jump into.
- Constant learner: Able to keep an eye on emerging trends to identify opportunities to prove out viability, timeliness and overall effectiveness of the numerous trends.
- Standards definition: Able to define and evolve data standards as technologies are implemented or retired.

Job Description

Texas Health Resources, one of the largest faith-based, nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States, is hiring a full time Director of Cyber Threat Management/Response.

Essential Duties:

Security Operations Service Delivery

Work with executive leadership to set security operations service delivery strategy.

Direct delivery of cyber incident response, investigation, threat intelligence and vulnerability management services.

Lead the development, architecture and operations of security analytics/monitoring systems and protection technologies.

Partner and collaborate with lines of business to protect, detect and respond to cyber threats.

Direct managed service providers and service level agreements.

Relationship Management

Manage relationships between Cyber Threat and Incident Response team and other organizational teams.

Plan and organize daily Security Operations, program activities and managed services providers.

Working with stakeholders develop cyber security policy, operational standards and processes.

Direct and coordinate cyber risk remediation activities with stakeholders.

Work with application and system owners to ensure effective solutions are implemented appropriately.

Continually test and measure the effectiveness of the organizational structure, identify improvements, and implement security measures to meet system needs.

Program Management

Work with executive leadership to develop program level strategy.

- Develop and direct the corporate Threat and Incident Management Programs.

- Develop and coordinate Corporate Cyber incident response plan.

- Oversee the development, collection and management of program metrics and measures.

- Develop and coordinate vulnerability management program.

- Lead program committees and projects.

Budget Planning, Contract Management, Staff Development

Develop and maintain an annual budget.

Provide monthly reporting related to actual vs. budgeted spend, as well as forecasting remaining year expenditures.

Manage costs and contracts associated with the delivery of security operations service delivery.

-Utilize internal and external resources to stay abreast of technology trends, as well as potential industry shifts.

Developing team through constant coaching and feedback, providing challenging goals and guaranteeing your people have the skills, knowledge and opportunities to grow.

Define, and validate implementation of, tactics for the development of staff within reporting structure.

Policy, Standards and Procedures

Oversee the development and maintenance of standard procedures and playbooks related to program and security operations service delivery.

Ensure that all necessary documentation is complete and followed.

Maintain accurate records for all systems and procedures.

Continuous Improvement and Effectiveness

Plan and organize daily, monthly and quarterly security operation service delivery metrics and measures , inspect staff execution of defined processes, and ensure complete and accurate reporting of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).

Day to day operations of the security operations service delivery practice, implementing and measuring a Quality Assurance and Constant Improvement methodology.

Continually test and measure the effectiveness of programs, processes and team, identify improvements, and implement them.

Validate the effectiveness of security systems/tools including protection systems, sensors, scanners, log collection, correlation and search, and tune as necessary.

Qualifications

Education
Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field.
Master's Degree Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field is preferred.

Experience
8 Years deep experience in leading cyber security programs, operations, assessment/testing, cyber security architecture/infrastructure, incident response and threat management services and teams, including real world experience in coordinating cyber risks, incidents and breaches and 2 years experience in a management role, leading people.

Licenses and Certifications
CISSP - Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred

Skills
Leadership skills, complex decision-making, written and verbal communications skills, productivity S/W, complex problem-solving, organization/prioritization.
Deep experience in leading cyber security operations, assessment/testing, cyber security architecture/infrastructure, incident response and threat management services and teams.
Experience in managing a team of greater than 10 employees.
Experience in coordinating cyber incidents and breaches.
Understanding of cybersecurity analytics, measurement and data science.
Expert and demonstrated knowledge of security infrastructure, incident response, threat and vulnerability management.
Must have in-depth knowledge of security controls and processes.
Must have exceptional analytic and project skills, the ability to make decisions, plan, schedule and organize work, work in teams, and customer service skills.
Capable of managing vendors, contactors, and a team up to 11 people to perform customer support, day to day operations, security operations functions, and projects.
Expertise in capital and operational expense budget planning , financial management, and resource. management (including the ability to develop cost-effective approaches to organizational needs.
Ability to communicate technical security information with all stakeholders and customers in straightforward terms, making complicated technical issues relatable for all.
Experience with cybersecurity governance, risk and compliance functions, threat modeling, identity and access management and cybersecurity operations.
Experience presenting results of assessments, findings, and other project information to customers with professional presentations skills and demeanor, facilitating meaningful discussion and feedback..
Demonstrated ability to build, lead, and develop effective, cohesive and collaborative management and operational teams.

Texas Health has 25 acute-care and short-stay hospitals that are owned, operated, joint-ventured or affiliated with the system. It has more than 3,800 licensed beds, more than 21,100 employees of fully-owned/operated facilities plus 1,400 employees of consolidated joint ventures, and counts more than 5,500 physicians with active staff privileges at its hospitals.

At Texas Health, we strive to create an atmosphere of respect, integrity, compassion and excellence for all who come in contact with us, be they patients or our employees. We are committed to diversity in our workforce, and our mission to serve spreads across ethnic, cultural, economic and generational boundaries. We invite you to join us in furthering your career through our accomplishments and philosophy of excellence

Company Description:

With 13 hospitals across the DFW Metroplex and one of the largest faith based health care systems in the United States, Texas Health has the resources to offer a variety of career growth opportunities with equally remarkable benefits. The system's primary service area consists of 16 counties in North Texas, home to more than 6.2 million people. Nurses can choose to work at urban, suburban, or rural facilities or at acute-care or short-stay hospitals. The ability to move within the system gives nurses a level of flexibility that’s hard to match.

Our values include respect, integrity, compassion, and excellence. These values allow us to remember that every member of our staff represents the healing hands and caring hearts of Texas Health Resources. Every one of us is working together to make health care human again. More importantly, Texas Health is a great place to work.

Apply for any of the open positions with Texas Health Resources today or stay in touch with us and join our Talent Community to receive email alerts of job opportunities.

Business Unit:Cubic Transportation SystemsCompany Details:Cubic offers an opportunity to provide innovative technology for government and commercial customers around the globe, helping to solve their future problems today. We’re the leading integrator of payment and information technology and services for intelligent travel solutions worldwide, and the leading provider of realistic combat training systems, secure communications and networking and highly specialized support services for military and security forces of the U.S. and allied nations.

At Cubic Transportation System (CTS)/Nextbus, we are building the next generation of transit solutions and we believe that Transit Management as a Service (TMaaS) will enable the next generation of transit environments and provides Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) capabilities for managing transit systems. We will achieve our vision by: Empowering travelers with richer information in more places. Proactively managing on-time performance for better customer satisfaction and Fully integrating transit information, operations and payments.

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in an innovative environment, we want to talk to you about your next role at NextBus! We are seeking employees inspired by technology, and motivated by the rewards of hard work, commitment, teamwork, quality, integrity, and respect. We invite you to explore opportunities with Cubic.Job Details:

Job Summary:

As part of the NextBus data science team you’ll build information-rich data products using cutting-edge techniques and technologies to solve transportation related challenges and problems. You’ll be leveraging machine learning, data modeling, and statistical modeling techniques to deliver new capabilities to the NextBus platform. You’ll add your strong problem solving and analytic skills to collaborate on data-focused projects and identify non-obvious relationships between disparate data sources. You’ll work under general supervision and regularly exercise discretionary and substantial decision-making authority.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Works with the data science team and stakeholders in an agile environment to address business challenges by harnessing structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data in a distributed processing environment.
Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse data sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement.
Develops software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources.
Prepares and delivers presentations that effectively describe complex quantitative methods in clear and concise communications.
Keeps up to date with technical as well as industry developments, analytics software/tools, trends, and recognized best practices.
Contributes to projects under the direction of project and product owners to adhere to funding, resourcing, schedule, and other constraints.
Minimum Job Requirements:

Four-year college degree, in statistics, economics, physics, mathematics, operations research, computer science, data engineering, or related field;
Experience with machine learning, data modeling, data integration, data mining, statistical modeling, and general data science best practices.
Experience with Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, Git and SQL in a Linux environment.
Experience using exploratory data analysis methodology in creating and implementing machine learning algorithms and advanced statistics such as: regression, clustering, decision trees, markov chains, monte carlo, kalman filters, scenario analysis and neural networks
Experience with cloud services including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform and Bluemix. Ability to collect data using XML and REST APIs.
Experience in visualizing data to stakeholders in a simple and concise manner through visualization software such as Tableau, Domo, ggplot, D3, Qlikview, Leaflet, etc.
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with real-time transit data such as GTFS-RT, SIRI, OrbCAD
Experience with transit schedule data such as GTFS
Experience with signal processing techniques
Requires fundamental knowledge and experience developing algorithms and analytics applications. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to details, critical thinking ability, and creativity. Must be able to abstract from ambiguous and sometimes conflicting information to identify opportunities for improvement and the critical business drivers and factors that influence outcomes. Must have demonstrated ability to produce high quality analytics applications that can be deployed in a repeatable and scalable fashion. Requires strong knowledge of statistics, signal processing, machine learning, predictive analytics, and other related techniques. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills used to effectively communicate and present complex information in terms appropriate to the audience. Incumbent will have well-developed research skills and knowledge of current data management principles, procedures, and other tools of the trade. Must be able to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously while balancing according to scope, budget and schedule. Prior experience working in the transportation or logistics industries desired.

Are you excited about helping our Travelers discover awesome vacation rental experiences? Are you passionate about creating programmatic content systems on a global scale? Are you a Product Manager that loves technology and enjoys leading teams to build exceptional products?

HomeAway is part of Expedia Group, one of the worlds largest providers of online travel lodging, transportation and experiences. HomeAway and Expedia source and enrich content and media from our Travelers, Partners and external sources to guide Travelers through their journey of discovery, shopping, booking and stay. Our content must be compelling, localized, personalized and scalable to engage our global marketplace.

What you'll do:

In this role, you will oversee a team of global product managers focused on property and destination content, including UGC, structured attributes, photos and virtual tours. You will collaborate extensively with HomeAway and Expedia teams to discover opportunities for development and leverage of core services for content generation, classification, enrichment and localization. These content services will be leveraged by our Traveler and Partner experience teams to provide compelling customer journeys that drive conversion. This role encompasses product strategy, stakeholder alignment, roadmap development and delivery, team development, and individual contribution.

Responsibilities
Map the customer acquisition, shopping and stay product strategy into a vision, strategy, and roadmap for core content services.
Identify areas of partnership and leverage for content services between Expedia and HomeAway, and incorporate into your product roadmap.
Lead and develop a team of globally deployed Content and Media product managers.
Serve as product owner for the core content and media services that fall within your purview.
Guide the development of product strategy and OKRs for your teams and share progress at key planning and operational events.
Incorporate data science within content and media platform services, to improve the quality of our content.
Evangelize and practice the test and learn methodology to quickly and efficiently identify and evaluate opportunities that will inform the roadmap.
Who you are:

You have demonstrated relevant and current expertise in the development of content and media services to facilitate the customer journey in a global marketplace. You are passionate about well-designed products, end user experience, and current and evolving standard methodologies in software development.

Qualifications
7+ years of product management in medium to large product organizations, working cross functionally and leading with influence.
2+ years experience developing programmatic content solutions through leveraging data science to enrich the customer journey.
Experience with online travel and/or consumer market places preferred.
Scientific mindset to make evidence-based decisions.
Understanding of core data science principles, model development and production launch.
Prior experience bringing globalized platform services to market. You understand the technical decisions that lead to global ready systems.
Deep understanding of the principles of online customer acquisition and shopping.
Prior experience leading a small team of product managers is a plus.
BS or BA in related field.
Willing to travel up to 25%.
Benefits & Perks:
Competitive health and insurance benefits.
Competitive salary.
Annual target bonus or commission.
Parental leave for up to 20 weeks (dependent on eligibility).
Paid vacation and sick time.
Vacation rental on a yearly basis (taxable benefit).
Employee Stock Purchase Program.
Free snacks and beverages.
Frequent company update talks with our leadership team.
Free listing on HomeAway.com.
Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk.
Discounted Metro & Rail pass.
Casual dress.
Why join us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.

About HomeAway

HomeAway, a world leader in the vacation rental industry, is the place to book beach houses, cabins, and condos with more than two million places to stay in 190 countries. The site makes it easy to find and book the perfect vacation rental for any getaway, often for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. HomeAway is part of the Expedia Group family of brands. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
Partner Account Manager, Agencies

Location – East Coast

Reports to - Partner Account Director, System Integrators & Agencies

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA is The Human Data Science Company, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. IQVIA has approximately 55,000 employees in more than 100 countries, all committed to making the potential of Human Data Science a reality, and we are actively hiring.

Reimagine healthcare with us

At IQVIA, you will have the opportunity to build your career, while helping our customers drive human health outcomes forward. We dedicate our experience, resources and reputation so that you can drive your career and choose the path that best defines your development and success.

The Technology Solutions division of IQVIA develops, markets, and implements healthcare-focused enterprise software applications to help life sciences customers drive their business from molecule to market.

Partnerships

Our Partnerships team engages 3rd parties such as System Integrators, Technology Vendors, Data Partners, and Agencies to build mutually beneficial, trusted relationships to accelerate growth within the Global Technology Solutions business. Each partner provides a unique value proposition to IQVIA through their services or solutions, and our goal is to maximize the return while building win-win relationships.

Agencies provide the tools and services to maximize the performance of IQVIA marketing for shared clients. Our Agency Partnership Program has a presence with over 100+ agencies around the world but needs to evolve to meet future needs of IQVIA, our partners, and our clients.

Role

As the Partner Account Manager, Agencies, you will oversee and transform the Agency Partnership Program, develop and maintain key partner relationships, and help drive client experience and success.

Specifically, you will:
Manage our agency partner program, designed to support and drive value from the digital agencies that build content for clients that use IQVIA technology products
Directly manage, or coordinate with cross-functional IQVIA teams, to provide agencies with onboarding, training & support
Expand the footprint of our agency partners and increase their propensity to recommend IQVIA products to their clients
Drive revenue growth from the agency program
Act as the main point of contact for Agency Partners
Develop and secure key partner relationships through onsite meetings, goal setting, planning, and partnership development activities
Target and establish relationships with key stakeholders in agencies who work with top enterprise accounts
Work with existing agency partners to identify and expand business opportunity with their client base
Identify opportunities and deliver content for agency presentations, trainings, and webinars
Secure, manage, and increase output of agency relationships through negotiations, contracts, and billing
Manage and transform the current Agency Partnership Program, inclusive of establishing performance measurement of the program
Experience
5-7 years of outside sales, agency, or related experience
Program management skills
Experience working in a multi-cultural, global organization
Strong relationship-building skills, technically minded and goal-driven
Self-starter with strong time management, organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple high-profile relationships in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of Healthcare/Life Sciences Industry and/or SaaS Technology a plus
BS/BA Degree or equivalent in relevant work experience

Plano 7 (31067), United States of America, Plano, Texas

At Capital One, were building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

Sr. Machine Learning Scientist

Machine Learning Scientist

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 100 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. We intend on repeating history and enabling the next wave of disruption in financial services leveraging AI and Machine Learning.

Department Summary:

Here in Plano, TX we are supporting our Financial Services division by using Machine Learning and AI to power signature consumer products and services that make searching, financing and re-financing their next car easier and fun!

Role Summary:

As a Machine Learning Scientist at Capital One, youll be part of a team thats leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in AI and Machine Learning and operating across massive datasets to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and difficulty in their auto buying and financing experience.

On any given day youll be:
Collaborating with a diverse set of partners and stakeholders from data science, business analysis, software engineering, product management, marketing and operations.
Designing, implementing and tuning deep learning models to enable large scale computer vision and image recognition capabilities enabling visual searches
Building models powering product recommenders for our car search service
Implementing deep reinforcement learning to help optimize marketing campaigns and consumer web/mobile experiences
Leveraging natural language processing to extract insights from massive amounts of unstructured data like agent notes and call center conversations
Making build vs use decisions on variety of open source products/implementations in AI/ML Space
The Ideal Candidate will be:
Technical: You have hands-on experience developing AI and Machine Learning solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right algorithm/approach for the job at hand. You are familiar with available open source AI/ML platforms, especially in deep learning/neural network space and comfortable working in cloud environments.
Academically sound: Still remember your foundational computer science theory and statistics curriculum. Those good old courses in Data Structures, Design of Algorithms, Automata Theory, Optimization Methods, Statistical Modeling, Linear Algebra.do not scare you
Innovative: You continually research and evaluate emerging trends in ML/AI space. You stay current on published state-of-the-art ML methods, technologies, and frameworks. You ask why, explore and openly share your disruptive ideas.
Business Friendly: You can analyze customer needs, cut through ambiguity and propose analytical solutions that drive towards impactful business outcomes.
Twenty-five years after Capital One was started its still led by its founder. Be ready to join a fun group of super smart folks, who see the customer first, and want to use their machine learning skills to make a difference.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science plus 2 years of experience in data analytics, or Masters Degree, or PhD
At least 2 years programming experience in one or more of the following: Python, Scala, C/C++, R
At least 1 year experience building Machine Learning solutions over open source platforms (like TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, CNTK, Caffe, DSSTNE.)
At least 1 year experience designing and developing enterprise-scale ML solutions in one or more of: Computer Vision/Image Recognition, Product Recommendation System, Personalization, NLP, Clickstream Analytics, Marketing Response Models
At least 1 year experience evaluating and leveraging various deep learning approaches or Neural Network architectures (CNNs, RNNs)
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters degree in Computer Science or a quantitative field with Machine Learning research focus
Academic thesis/published papers in ML space or robust public source code repository with ML solution(s)
Presentations or publications at top-tier AI/Machine Learning conferences
Open source contributions in ML space
Prior experience supporting consumer products/services or marketing applications
Comfortable working in cloud environment
Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Deliver through key stakeholders across multiple businesses. You’ll work with the team leaders and managers to translate abstract concepts, needs and goals into actionable solutions.

Blueprint Technologies is a group of solution minded thinkers changing the face of Technology in Bellevue, WA. We follow a Mission, Vision, and Core Values that allow us to function as a collaborative unit.

Blueprint is a technology solutions firm that connects strategy, product and delivery. We help companies digitally transform. Why you want to be a part of Blueprint?

We are innovators. Motivators. Thought provokers. And coffee drinkers. Our collective backgrounds bring diverse perspectives that enable us to consistently think differently. Our people are our solutions. We want you to bring your biggest and best ideas to help positively impact our culture, clients and the community around us. We believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our benefits include full medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as paid time off, 401k, paid volunteer hours and tuition reimbursement.

This team is looking for thoughtful, analytical, and high energy candidate to join a new team that will be responsible for delivering onboarding support services. The Onboarding Engineer role will be responsible for the technical aspects of onboarding customers and partners which includes provide proactive guidance and remediation assistance. As the Support Engineer for this business you will drive the technical execution and provide automation improvements to maintain customer and partner satisfaction during the 'Deployment' phase. You are responsible to deliver the customer Onboarding Experience for services while utilizing the company's IP and assets across partners, services engineering and support teams, the field sales organizations and business groups. The Support Engineer role will require developing exceptionally strong and transparent working relationships with the teams to deliver expected customer and business results.

Your specific responsibilities will include:
Execute, manage and lead a set of web based computing system customers and partners thru the Onboarding technical process.
Proven history of demonstrated technical skills and leadership
Assist with customers and partners with configuration of onboarding tools and processes technology
Analyze, develop and communicate key Onboarding process and technology improvement feedback for web based computing system Onboarding and entire deployment cycle.
Develop, foster and maintain effective customer and partner relationships maintaining CSAT
Be responsive to customer needs.
Develop foster and maintain effective working relationships with engineering, marketing, Enterprise Services\Support and field sales and partner teams to deliver key business metrics

Successful Candidate Competencies:
Customer and Partner Focus: proven experience driving business impact based on a deep understanding of customer and partner needs.
Self-driven engaging Onboarding Engineer with proven history of demonstrated technical skills and leadership
Strong communication skills to effectively drive recommendations and land priorities across customers, partners, senior executives and across organizational boundaries
Demonstrated ability to lead, manage, build and deliver customer and partner business results thru an engineering or professional services team
web based competency: Possess the knowledge and personal conviction to articulate why the cloud and web based computing system in particular is a transformational industry change.
Strong technical leadership, relationship building to create, reinforce, motivate and guide customers and partners
Strong problem solving ability ranging from conceptualization to implementation
Web based computing system technical competency: Possess a broad knowledgebase of web based computing system technical architecture. Familiarity and technical understanding of the FastTrack experience and process
Collaboration: exceptional collaborator on complex multi-faceted programs across multiple groups with varying priorities.
Applicants must be comfortable with ambiguity while striving for clarity with the personal desire and initiative to drive proactive business impacting change and clarity.

*Careers that Change Lives**
Help us tame our data. Be part of Data team focused on transforming how chronic disease is managed through application of modern data science engineering application solutions, catering to both your engineering mentality and desire to make a difference in world. With access to large amounts of related data, you will help create data solutions that simplify care and improve clinical outcomes.

Medtronic Diabetes is focused on transforming diabetes care for better freedom and great health, serving patients across the continuum of diabetes. Our goal is to become a holistic diabetes management company focused on making a real difference in outcomes and cost. We want to transform healthcare toward value-based models by driving both product and business model innovation with the goal of elevating patient experience, improving clinical outcomes and lowering the total cost of care for our customers. Data driven applications and you would be central to making this happen

*About Medtronic**
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

About Citi

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.

Seeking Sr. Monitoring&Analytics Engineer as Primary Tech Lead to create and deliver a technology strategy that help identify key patterns to understand client interactions, impactful availability and performance of payment eco-systems. This role will include working with clients, building a data centric team, and leading technical strategy focusing on data science and predictive analysis. The predictive analytics and data science aspect of this role provides strategic thought leadership and technology governance to drive a consistent data and statistical model for advancing our monitoring and support capabilities through the build out of data and analytics systems.

The role will work closely with partners in other peer groups to deliver innovative solutions for transaction processing, payments, collation of forensic data and development of business rules in support of business strategy. Opportunity exists for using data analytics/data science to gain unique insight and competitive advantage for the business.

The role of Monitoring Specialist requires a high degree of troubleshooting and problem solving skills. Requires the ability to understand how various systems and performance monitoring metrics' data and information are centrally-gathered, then analyzed and interpreted in detail to isolate and articulate any key risks/concerns/issues, and then make recommendations and related decisions on best course of action(s) to take.

Program Management

* Provide thought leadership to senior management teams regarding best practices for monitoring and data analytics

* Engage business and development teams to under monitoring and data analytics requirements

* Manage the implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring, data analytics and reporting solutions

* Conduct presentations and provide training on tool usage

* Research, evaluate and perform POCs of vendor solutions

* Lead Data Analytics Forums involving cross-functional teams

* Be the champion and advocate for innovation in the areas of enterprise data analytics, monitoring and automation

* Monitoring and Data Analytics Architect

* Develop strategies for capturing and interpreting data related to the end-user's web experience. Data would include: user journeys, user struggles, client trends, results of multivariate testing, etc

* Develop executive dashboards and scorecards to visualize data

* Architect and implement big data solutions to extract and visualize application performance data from multiple resources

* Develop and document best practices, standards, and processes with regards to the enterprise monitoring and data analytics program

* Write programs and scripts to monitor application health; integrate these programs with the enterprise monitoring system

Qualifications

Req Qualifications:

* Required Experience and Education

* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science

* 10+ years' experience working in large scaled, business critical datacenter environments

* 10+ years' experience as enterprise solution architect

* 7+ years' experience in customer support environments

* 7+ years' experience with business requirements gathering/analysis.

* 3+ years of cross cultural experience

* Proven project planning and management experience

Required Skillsets

Technical Skills

* Expert experience in application performance tuning and troubleshooting

* Expert level experience in scripting (KSH, Perl, Python, etc)

* Expert Windows and Unix system administration skills

* Advanced understanding of web protocols (HTTP, HTTPS)

* Advanced understanding of datacenter network architectures

* Advanced experienced with various datastore technologies (both SQL and NoSQL)

* Intermediate understanding of machine learning concepts

* Proven experience in developing solutions for data extraction, aggregation and reporting

* Experience with monitoring tools such as: Appdynamic, IBM Tealeaf, CA APM, ITRS, HP BAC, Foglight

* Experience with big data, middleware and reporting tools such as: Hadoop, Elasticsearch, Flume, Logstash Kafka, Kibana, Splunk, Microstrategy, Qlikview

Soft Skills

* Expert in being able to discover actionable business insights from machine data

* Experienced in the ability to explain technical concepts in layman's terms

* Expert in the ability to convert technical solutions into business ROI

* Proven ability to design and deliver innovative solutions with minimum supervision

* Experience in presenting to large audiences both in person and via conference calls

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)

* Experience with presenting to senior level management

Cognizant's AI & Analytics (AIA) is seeking an Analytics Client Services Executive to join its growing organization. We are currently looking for someone in the Dallas or West Coast.

Key Responsibilities:
We're looking for driven individual with strong advanced analytics and data science background in retail and consumer goods (RCG) industries to take on practice development and revenue generation activities within North America. Your primary role is to create demand for our analytics services and solutions from within our existing base of RCG customers as well as new prospects. You will be joining a high performance team of AI & Analytics, specifically focusing on RCG analytics.

Job Description / Expectations

Drive profitable revenue growth though new business development for advanced analytics and data science opportunities in RCG space.
Responsible for pre-sales consulting and solutioning for advanced analytical and data sciences opportunities.
At least 12-15 years of professional experience; 10 years of selling and delivering advanced analytical solutions experience in retail and consumer goods industry.
Must have experience in handling full range of analytics services for RCG clients including but not limited to sales analytics, marketing analytics, forecasting, digital analytics, social media analytics, customer analytics, customer propensity modeling, media mix optimization, campaign management analytics, market basket analytics, customer loyalty, supply chain optimization, shelf-space optimization, geospatial analytics, product pricing analytics etc.
String understanding of shifting landscape in retail and consumer goods space due to ecommerce and digital trends.
Must have hands on analytical modeling experience in any of the data science platforms such as R, Python, SAS, Alteryx, Spark ML, Azure ML, Tensorflow etc. Exposure to newer technologies like Databricks, Data Robot, H2O will be a plus.
Exposure and understanding of third party / syndicated data like Nielsen, IRI, Epsilon, Experian, Comscore etc. Knowledge of DMP platforms like Krux, BlueKai will be a plus.
Proven track record of in all areas of advanced analytics including descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics
Should be able to collaborate effectively across a large global organization to deliver the right analytics solutions to our RCG clients.
Proven track record of selling and delivering large multi-year analytics deals to RCG companies in US.
MBA/Masters/Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics or Operations Research is a must. PhD will be a big plus.
Good knowledge of AI/ML techniques, application of AI/ML in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), deep learning techniques and application.
Up to 50% or more travel may be expected
Develop contact matrix and establish strong relationships with marketing heads, category managers, brand managers, product managers, eCommerce heads, Chief Analytics Officers (CAO) and other business leaders in the retail and consumer space.
Develop and manage strategic relationships with niche analytics solution providers, cultivate new alliances locally and globally, and monitor competitive activity in North America with a view of looking establishing joint ventures and alliances or acquisitions in this area
Develop account relationships, identify opportunities and capture analytics opportunities at strategic accounts within assigned geography or industry.

Responsibilities:
Lead workshops and innovation sessions with clients, multi-disciplinary, and cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities and artificial intelligence solutions utilizing processes and best practices to plan, lead, and execute delivery of artificial intelligence engagements; working across different areas (risk management, financial services, mergers and acquisitions, and public policy)

Description:

Title: Senior Data Scientist

Location: Houston, TX USA

Company

For the past 40 years, Wood Mackenzie has established its reputation as a trusted source of intelligence, enriching lives by empowering clients with unique insight on the world’s natural resources.

Now, as part of the Verisk family, that legacy is even stronger. Aligning with the world’s leading data analytics company extends our ability to support clients with our unrivalled analysis and advice.

Together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence that informs the strategy that will ultimately shape the future direction of our global natural resources.

Role Purpose

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist for our Analytics Lab group to generate innovative data solutions that will solve complex business problems in collaboration with our clients. They will have experience in applying data mining techniques, performing statistical interpretation and building algorithmic models utilising expansive datasets. They should have strong communication and interpersonal skills and will be able to present their findings to colleagues from all areas of the business and to clients.

The role requires a strong data-focussed personality, with a keen eye for detail. They should have experience of working in a data environment with multiple streams of data. We are looking for someone who has an innovative approach to working with data and is willing to learn technologies that create new data solutions.

The successful candidate will embrace advanced techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence. They will be responsible for applying data science to our client’s business problems and communicating the new insights developed through their work. Achieving results will hinge on an ability to work collaboratively with colleagues across organizations and stakeholder groups, developing creative solutions to new problems, and leveraging the expertise and talents of Wood Mackenzie and the wider Verisk company group.

Main Responsibilities
Developing analytical solutions using a variety of methodologies including predictive modelling, text mining, forecasting, network analytics and image processing
Performing model validation, and measuring model performance. Run and interpret hypothesis testing
Promote a culture of continual growth, ensure we adapt with technical innovations to deliver new insights and creative solutions. Coach junior colleagues in these methods
Report findings and interpretation of results through data visualisation or presentation in an effective manor
Create prototype tools to demonstrate findings – building into scalable solutions where appropriate.
Hold strategic relationships with different business stakeholders across Research, Product Management and Technology. Relate actions to strategic and commercial goals.
Knowledge & Experience Required
Strong analytical skills including algorithm design with different mathematical approaches such as cluster and principal component analysis, linear and logistic regression
Expert programming skills, particularly in Python, R, SAS
Has delivered projects using Machine Learning libraries, such as TensorFlow, AML, scikit-learn, MLlib
Strong data modelling skills and experience of working with both structured and unstructured data
Evidence of having delivered scalable solutions using Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig
Advanced skills in a data visualisation packages (such as D3, PowerBI, GGplot).
Core Competencies
Excellent problem solving and analysis skills coupled with great communication skills with the ability to coach junior colleagues
Strong organization, interpersonal and planning skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously for own work and others across multi-disciplinary teams
Experience and passion for working with complex data with a strong attention to detail and statistical intuition
Evidence of delivering innovative solutions having challenged conventional thinking and demonstrated how data science can inform and support decision making.
Wood Mackenzie Core Values

Wood Mackenzie is a place where we are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment which encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging.

Our core values are:
Respect for the Individual
Integrity
Passion
Persistence
Confidence with humility
Excellence
Teamwork
We understand the importance of achieving balance between work, family and other life commitments. We are open to considering flexible working arrangements to enable the greatest spectrum of talent to contribute to Wood Mackenzie's success.

EEO statement

Unsolicited resumes submitted to Maplecroft by any external recruitment agency via Internet, e-mail, fax, or U.S. mail become the property of Wood Mackenzie and we are not responsible for any fees associated with those resumes.

Job Description
Position:

Senior Full Stack Developer,
Hybrid Cloud Management System AIOps

Job Description

IBM Cloud Brokerage Services (ICBS) business unit is seeking an experienced full stack developer with product development experience in web-based SaaS products. The ICBS team develops applications for hybrid cloud management across the lifecycle of plan, order, deploy, operate and govern customer workloads.

As a Sr. Full Stack Software Developer, you will be responsible for design, development, and testing the Hybrid Cloud Management System AIOps application. You will closely work with the ICBS Product Management, Architecture, and Delivery teams to understand product requirements and roadmap from both a business, technical, and delivery perspective. You will collaborate with the teams to commit to delivering stories/tasks/defects within a sprint cycle. You will participate in the current agile development process based on the Spotify model. You will mentor and lead junior development resources to ensure increase in the productive output.

The successful candidate will be ambitious and self-directed with a passion for Agile-based Cloud-native development in a Spotify model. You will have prior software product development experience across the full stack of user interface, API, data, and analytics development with a thorough understand of DevOps and its supporting services and tools. You will also have proven analytical capabilities, strong python development skills, and web application development experience, and the tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment. Posting Job Description

Job Duties:

Reporting to the Executive, Data Supply Chain Management within the Enterprise Data Group (EDG), the Principal, Business Intelligence Center of Excellence will lead the establishment and operation of EDG's BI COE. In partnership with leaders and peers, the Principal, BI COE is responsible for developing a BI strategy and roadmap to support the EDG strategic vision. It is the responsibility of this role topartner with EDG and business unit leadership to establish requirements for the new BI capability and then lead implementation of the solution and build the BI COE.

This role will play a key part of our data supply chain transformation aimed at supercharging EDG's position as the innovative engine that powers CoreLogic with fast reliable content. As we improve processes, adopt new technologies and add capabilities, we need a strong BI leader to establish a BI COE that will ensure we are maximizing the value realized from our data. The strengthened BI capability will contribute to strong data quality, additional process improvement opportunities and highlight ways to provide additional value for our customers.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for building, managing and documenting the EDG Business Intelligence strategy.
Establish and lead the EDG BI COE to ensure the successful adoption of BI content, alignment with corporate strategy and best practices, and a standard scalable platform for BI delivery.
Responsible for providing thought leadership regarding Business Intelligence approaches and capabilities, driving EDG to maximize the value realized from our data.
Monitors industry trends and directions, recommends new capabilities and adapts to changing needs.
Partner with stakeholders including Operations, Data Management and Business Unit leaders to capture requirements for KPIs, insights, dashboards and reporting capabilities.
Understand and analyze complex processes with a degree of proficiency to recommend alternative or additional KPIs in alignment with the EDG vision.
Proactively partner with Data Science group to recommend high-leverage BI initiatives and focus areas that haven't yet been requested.
Posting Job Summary

Join the team that powers the global real estate economy - CoreLogic is an innovative, future focused company whose vision is to deliver unique property-level insights that power the global real estate economy.

We are a $1.95 billion in sales company with more than 6,000 employees globally serving the financial services and insurance industries. We are evolving at a rapid pace and the clients we serve are challenged from every direction, which means we are growing and innovating to help drive their success. Working together, and differentiated by our superior data, analytics and data-enabled solutions, we empower our clients to make smarter business decisions through data-driven insights. We take initiative, are fully accountable, build respect and trust, make transparency a must and engage, include and collaborate at every turn.

We take pride in our work and believe in cultivating a work environment that supports and values our greatest asset: our talented employees.

Experience managing large, complex BI projects and teams

Practical experience with the PMI PMBOK preferred

Innovate. Collaborate. Shine. Lighthouse KPMG's Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics has both applied data science, AI, and big data architecture capabilities. Be a part of a high-energy, diverse, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. For you, that translates into the chance to work on a wide range of projects covering technologies and solutions from AI to optimization and the power to have a real impact in the business world. So, bring your creativity and pioneering spirit to KPMG Lighthouse.

KPMG is currently seeking a Sr. Associate to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics.

Responsibilities:
Rapidly prototype, develop, and optimize D&A implementations without the supervision of senior team members to tackle the Big Data and Data Science needs for a variety of Fortune 1000 corporations and other major organizations
Using waterfall/agile methodology, practice full software development lifecycle to develop and maintain D&A solutions on premise/cloud/KPMG-hosted/hybrid infrastructure; Full stack software development following software engineering guidelines and industry best practices for code quality; Conduct regular design and code review, and build technical documentation
Act as the data owner in cross-disciplinary teams; Discover, profile, acquire, process, model, and own data for the solutions
Implement data processing pipelines, data mining/science algorithms, and visualization engineering to help clients distill insights from rich data sources (social media, news, internal/external documents, emails, financial data, client data, and operational data)
Actively remain involved in research, experiment, and applying leading/emerging Big Data methodologies (serverless data lake, microservices, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, AWS, MS Azure, and GCP)
Act as the data engineering SME in the process for pursuing innovations, target solutions, and extendable platforms for Lighthouse, KPMG and client
Qualifications:
Minimum of three years of relevant software development experience in related industries, preferably professional services; Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical personals at all levels
Bachelor's degree or Master's degree from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field; or a PhD from an accredited college/university in related field
Demonstrated ability to pick up and learn new technologies quickly; Experience and knowledge of production software system development: have completed 2+ production software systems development & release

Hands-on experience and knowledge in distributed computing architecture, massive-parallel processing big data platforms (Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS, Spark, Hive/Impala, H-Base/MongoDB/Casandra, and Teradata/Netezza/Redshift); mainstream cloud infrastructure (AWS, MS Azure, GCP, and their D&A related microservices)
Ability to travel up to eighty percent of the time. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future

ID: 493859
Type: Researchers: Contract
Location: San Antonio, TX
Categories: Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity, Data Analytics/Science, Electronic Warfare, Machine Learning, Software Development/Design
Job Description

The position is based on-site with the project sponsor at Lackland AFB, Texas.

The Technical Liaison Software Engineer will work closely with researchers, analysts, and a wide array of program stakeholders to co-develop, test, and integrate high quality automated systems. These systems will work with massive data-sets, integrate expert systems and machine learning techniques to solve hybrid cyber-security, electronic warfare, and intelligence analysis problems.

The liaison will coordinate various on-site and reach-back activities with Atlanta-based developers and perform the following duties:
Conduct applied cyberspace technology research; develop research and engineering strategies for mitigation of risk in systems and technology programs; design and develop hardware and software tools, models and prototypes; perform technology and engineering analysis to include systems engineering and systems of systems engineering analysis supporting the design, development, interoperability, exploitability and testing of hardware and software at the component, subsystem, and system level.
Develop rapid cutting-edge cyber solutions to respond to advanced persistent threats. Design platforms and tools that enable distributed and on-site cyberspace signatures analysis, sensor performance, and system response and conduct testing and integration with network sensors and training as required.
Support research in cyber, electronic warfare (EW), and intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) convergence, which might be defined as an “engagement event” that includes both free-space electromagnetic spectrum (EMS) energy and wired electronic networks. Provide recommendations for specified areas of research and development and identify and forecast cyber threat capability gaps and how the US government should posture itself to counter these threats.
Provide analytical assessments, recommendations, and road maps that will be instrumental in helping senior leaders define requirements and make informed acquisition decisions.
Provide instructional training, with appropriate instructional materials, to government employees on all developmental, analytical, research, tactics, techniques, and procedural methodologies that are developed.
Education & Length of Experience

Research Engineer/Scientist/Technologist/Associate I
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Physics.
Research Engineer/Scientist/Technologist/Associate II
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Physics and three (3) years of relevant full-time experience after completion of that degree,
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Physics and five (5) years of relevant full-time experience after completion of a Bachelor’s degree, or
A Doctoral degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Physics.
Required Minimum Qualifications
At least five (5) years professional experience in the software engineering domain. Concurrent experience in cyber security and/or intelligence analysis domain within the DoD/IC is a plus.
Knowledge of at least two of the following: Python, Java, C languages, R
An understanding of cyber security issues and/or intelligence analysis is also required.
Candidate must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.
Preferred Qualifications
Current, industry-recognized certifications (CISSP, GIAC) or the ability to become certified within one year of hire is a plus.
Experience with Machine Learning tools and techniques like SciPy, Tensorflow, Caffe, etc., is a plus
Experience with the Hadoop or Apache Spark ecosystem is a plus.
U.S. Citizenship Requirements

Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Clearance Type Required

Top Secret

Diversity & Inclusion

Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) at Georgia Tech Research Institute aims to enhance the Institute’s mission of solving the world’s most complex technical problems by creating a workforce with a shared appreciation for diversity, raising awareness around inclusiveness, and fostering a sense of belonging and appreciation for all members of our community.

Who is Blueprint?

Blueprint Technologies is a group of solution minded thinkers changing the face of Technology. We follow a Mission, Vision, and Core Values that allow us to function as a collaborative unit.

What are our Solutions?

Blueprint is a technology solutions firm that connects strategy, product and delivery. We help companies digitally transform. We have a special focus in cloud and infrastructure, data platform and engineering, data science and analytics, organizational modernization and customer experience optimization.

Why you want to be a part of Blueprint?

We are innovators, motivators, and thought provokers. Our collective backgrounds bring diverse perspectives that enable us to consistently think differently. Our people are our solutions. We want you to bring your biggest and best ideas to help positively impact our culture, clients, and the community. We believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our benefits include full medical, dental, and vision coverage, as well as paid time off, paid volunteer hours, and tuition reimbursement.

Role Description
The Account Manager (AM) is key to the partner management strategy in the Microsoft FastTrack Center and is the main point of contact for enterprise partners in the FastTrack Ready Partner (FRP) Program. An AM builds and maintains relationships with enterprise partners, thinks outside the box to help partners commit to the FRP, and provides the vehicle for the partner to reach their goals. The AM will be responsible for presenting status updates on a weekly basis with data pulled from PowerBI to the partners and the program's executive team.

Key business metrics & responsibilities will include:

· O365 Partner Onboarding Education

· Deliver and report key business metrics include identified blockers and other opportunities that focus on accelerating Cloud consumption.

· Be responsive and attentive to customer and partner needs

· Develop and maintain effective relationships with enterprise partners and secure their commitment to the FastTrack Ready Partner Program.

· Manage customer and partner accounts within expected timeframes while continually driving increased effectiveness and thus reducing costs

· Grow new programs within the Microsoft FastTrack Center

· Drive growth and be accountable for performance measured by consumption, usage, and adoption

Candidate Competencies & Required Skills

· Successful account management history is a must

· Working technical knowledge of Microsoft O365, M365, and EM+S at a high level

· Strong executive presence, including communication and presentation skills to C-level audiences

· Must be self-driven, engaging, and have a high level of self-assurance with the ability to influence and direct others

· Proven ability to identify and scope problems ranging from conceptualization to implementation

· Demonstrated ability to create narratives that are targeted to partners and customers on an emotional level that deliver clear outcomes and a call to action

· Strong problem solving and collaboration aptitude

· Ability to handle conflicts with internally and external stakeholders

· Exceptional collaborator on complex multi-faceted programs across multiple groups with varying priorities

· Must be comfortable with ambiguity while striving for clarity with the personal desire and initiative to drive proactive business changes

· The desire and ability to learn is vital

· Experience managing partner relationships is a plus

· Bilingual (English/Spanish) is a plus

Position Summary

The Senior Workforce Analytics Advisor is responsible for generating predictive analytical findings that enable the evolving Human Resources and business needs. This role conducts extensive and multivariate analysis on Workforce (HR), Financial, Sales, and Operational data sets while providing support to the Workforce Analytics Team. The Senior Workforce Analytics Advisor will be expected to apply a variety of statistical concepts to elevate the level of insights generated from the Workforce Analytics function, while consistently working to create and socialize innovative, consumable, data-driven stories that lead to action. Moreover, this role will act as an internal consultant to HR leadership, business leaders, and other key stakeholders regarding the alignment of the workforce with business needs.

General Duties and Responsibilities

(This is a representative list of the general duties the position may be asked to perform, and is not intended to be all-inclusive)
Responsible for generating predictive models across a variety of data sources (Workforce, Financial, Sales, Operational, External) that enable the evolving Human Resources and Operational strategies
Gathers, consolidates, normalizes and analyzes data from Human Resource, Operational, Sales, and Financial systems to extract meaningful insights through statistical control techniques, such as logistical regression and the design of processes
Applies expertise in people research, quantitative and qualitative analysis, data science, and data visualization to help optimize the complete employee lifecycle, from workforce planning through retention
Proactively researches and synthesizes large amounts of internal and external data to identify trends impacting FedEx Office Human Capital needs while communicating relevant information along the way
Presents relevant insights in clear, succinct manner and effectively demonstrates the implications of these trends on the business in order to influence key stakeholders (often non-technical audience) to take action on recommendations
Define and roadmap the Advanced Analytics long-term strategy for Human Resources

Who is Blueprint?

Blueprint Technologies is a group of solution minded thinkers changing the face of Technology in Bellevue, WA. We follow a Mission, Vision, and Core Values that allow us to function as a collaborative unit.

What are our Solutions?

Blueprint is a technology solutions firm that connects strategy, product and delivery. We help companies digitally transform. We have a special focus in cloud and infrastructure, data platform and engineering, data science and analytics, organizational modernization and customer experience optimization.

Why you want to be a part of Blueprint?

We are innovators. Motivators. Thought provokers. And coffee drinkers. Our collective backgrounds bring diverse perspectives that enable us to consistently think differently. Our people are our solutions. We want you to bring your biggest and best ideas to help positively impact our culture, clients and the community around us. We believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our benefits include full medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as paid time off, 401k, paid volunteer hours and tuition reimbursement.

Blueprint is currently looking for a Visualization Architect to work in our Seattle or Dallas office.

The Visualization Architect will be an integral part of the Solutions Delivery team reporting to the Delivery Operations Manager. This person will be tasked with creating scorecards, dashboards, and ad-hoc reports as needed around metrics and data for all internal and external teams within Blueprint Consulting Services.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Prepare, maintain and distribute reports, dashboards, and scorecards using visualization tools such as Tableau and PowerBI
Create or utilize source system APIs to acquire data to be displayed in visualization tools
Gain understanding of source system data and how it applies to financial/budget management and other key metrics for all activities within Blueprint Technologies
Work with business operations and other key stakeholders to generate ad-hoc reports
Identify process improvement opportunities based on data analysis
Translate metrics and data into story of engagement ROI to be used as sales enablement tools
Qualifications:
Working knowledge of accounting and financial/budgetary principles
Background in metrics development and management including ROI
Expert level experience in 3rd party reporting tools including Tableau and PowerBI
Programming skills in API development and customization
Foundational knowledge of datawarehousing, datamarts, and ETL process
