Job Summary
Hilton is creating a best-in-class data & analytics department that will lead a connected ecosystem of data, technology, tools, techniques, people and processes. This innovative data & analytics function will drive advanced analytics and actionable insights to help drive Hilton's performance.

What will I be doing?
The Analytics team serves as internal consultants to key functions across the business, including Hilton's Customer, Marketing, Digital, Revenue, and Sales organizations, with specialized support for the executive leadership team. The team consists of both embedded subject matter experts and leaders (like this role), who serve as strategic advisors to key partners, and technical experts, who are proficient in Tableau, R, SAS and MicroStrategy. The team is fully integrated within the business functions in order to ensure close partnerships and more effectively measure and drive company performance.

Collaborating with the Senior Director, Digital and Marketing Analytics, you will be responsible for leading analytics for all aspects of Hilton's digital journey in close partnership with the Digital Product Innovation (DPI) team.

More specifically, you will be:
• Partnering with Hilton's SVP Digital Product Innovation to drive digital product strategy from an analytics and data perspective
• Building up a new team of Digital Product Analysts that will be deeply integrated with the DPI Product pods
• Developing testing, implementation, and execution plans to achieve DPI goals and objectives
• Leading the Digital Product critical metric and target setting process
• Utilizing and synchronizing various data sources to develop fact-based and data-supported recommendations for the business
• Establishing and leading analytical methods and techniques, such as predictive analytics, enterprise decision support, and web analytics
• Collaborating with others throughout the broader Analytics organization to support ad-hoc analysis
• Educating others on how to leverage insights from self-service tools and analytics to drive business decisions
• Partnering closely with Digital Architecture team to ensure appropriate tracking and Adobe Suite setup
Direct Reports: Four (4) Direct Reports
What are we looking for?
We are seeking problem solvers who are passionate about hospitality and who love the chance to create extraordinary guest experiences. We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
• Collaborative and interpersonal teammates who build positive relationships, exhibit tact and earn trust
• Strong communicators, both verbally and in writing, who effectively communicate at all levels of the organization
• Flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems
• Self-starters who take initiative in leading goals, utilize analytical skills and possess adaptability to change
• Accountable individuals who take ownership of projects, effectively communicate results and recommend improvements
• Respectful teammates who possess a good work ethic and high degree of integrity

To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
• BA/BS Bachelor's Degree
• Seven (7) years of professional experience
• Five (5) years of hands-on experience with enterprise web analytics (i.e., Google Analytics Premium, Adobe Analytics
• Five (5) years of experience with website testing and conversion optimization
• Three (3) years working with advanced analytics, using analytic tools, benchmarking and bold analyses, and business scenario modeling
• Three (3) years coaching business users through data representation, interpretation, and storytelling of data
• Three (3) years of experience with report and dashboard design and development
• Management Experience (type): Supervisor/Manager: 1-3 People
It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
• MA/MS Master's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Marketing, Communication or related field
• Ten (10) years of professional experience
• Three (3) years spent leading a team of direct reports
What will it be like to work for Hilton?
Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing extraordinary guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.

We're seeking a small group of unbelievably skilled and thoughtful designers to define and execute against a giant vision that builds upon what Uber has brought to the world so far.



Join the Uber Design team, you'll work among design oriented engineers, product managers and some of the best designers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, hybrid (technology/operations) environment.





Who You Are



You’re a generalist with a sweet spot, or a specialist looking to broaden your skills.

You focus on UI or UX. We're interested in skilled designers with first, titles a distant second.



You're an amazing craftsperson. Your portfolio, based on 3+ years of experience in design, displays quality examples and inspiring projects that tackle interaction design problems.



You believe in craftsmanship and create elegant and compelling designs, over and over.

Your portfolio has some best-in-class work. You're a walking encyclopedia of microinteractions in use (on mobile, web, desktop, etc), and have nuanced views on how to make many of them even better.

Cross-platform is your style.

You know what translates from desktop and what doesn't, or why you'd opt for one solution for iOS and another on Android.

You've shipped product.

You've weathered release cycles and know what details matter at each stage, how to motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right, how to translate insights from user studies into meaningful action, and what's most likely to go afoul at each stage.

Prototyping is a key part of your toolset

You've prototyped on multiple platforms. You've made last-minute tweaks between user studies. You know how to be speedy and resourceful, but dream of better prototyping tools.

Requirements

Comfortable with cross functional collaboration between Research, Design, Product, Eng, Data Science and Marketing

Understands how to translate research insights into actionable design

Demonstrates understanding of service design/systems thinking and integrating products/services across a platform

About the Teams

We are highly user-centric and we deeply believe we can innovate our way out of any box. The role demands great execution, bold innovation, obsession with quality, fearlessness and optimism to be inspired by the unknown and never settle, solving problems with creativity while keeping the user in mind and ambition to take projects to the finish line.

Rider - The Rider team is responsible for accelerating demand growth across 400+ cities worldwide.

Driver - The Driver team is focused on accelerating driver growth, engagement, and retention across 300+ cities worldwide.

Maps - The Maps team builds high quality and compelling Maps Data and Maps Services like Search, Display, Routing and Navigation.

Product Platform - The Product & Platform team acts as internal consultants who partner with data science, product, and marketing teams to tackle some of Uber’s toughest challenges.

Trust & Safety - The Trust & Safety team designs highly visible products to make riders, drivers, and cities even safer. Our Driving Safety products automatically detect dangerous driving situations and help reinforce safe driving habits. Our Personal Safety products help drivers and riders feel more supported while on the road.

Financial Products/Wallet - This team’s work has massive internal and external exposure across the Uber Credit Card, Wallet, Gift Cards and many more products.

Uber for Business - This team is responsible for creating the platform that lets large groups of people use Uber services together.

Learn more about the Design Team and the work being done here https://www.uber.design

At Capital One, were building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

Principal Machine Learning Scientist

Principal Machine Learning Scientist

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 100 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. We intend on repeating history and enabling the next wave of disruption in financial services leveraging AI and Machine Learning.

Department Summary:

Here in Plano, TX we are supporting our Financial Services division by using Machine Learning and AI to power signature consumer products and services that make searching, financing and re-financing their next car easier and fun!

Role Summary:

As a Machine Learning Scientist at Capital One, youll be part of a team thats leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in AI and Machine Learning and operating across massive datasets to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and difficulty in their auto buying and financing experience.

On any given day youll be:
Collaborating with a diverse set of partners and stakeholders from data science, business analysis, software engineering, product management, marketing and operations.
Designing, implementing and tuning deep learning models to enable large scale computer vision and image recognition capabilities enabling visual searches
Building models powering product recommenders for our car search service
Implementing deep reinforcement learning to help optimize marketing campaigns and consumer web/mobile experiences
Leveraging natural language processing to extract insights from massive amounts of unstructured data like agent notes and call center conversations
Making build vs use decisions on variety of open source products/implementations in AI/ML Space
The Ideal Candidate will be:
Technical: You have hands-on experience developing AI and Machine Learning solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right algorithm/approach for the job at hand. You are familiar with available open source AI/ML platforms, especially in deep learning/neural network space and comfortable working in cloud environments.
Academically sound: Still remember your foundational computer science theory and statistics curriculum. Those good old courses in Data Structures, Design of Algorithms, Automata Theory, Optimization Methods, Statistical Modeling, Linear Algebra.do not scare you
Innovative: You continually research and evaluate emerging trends in ML/AI space. You stay current on published state-of-the-art ML methods, technologies, and frameworks. You ask why, explore and openly share your disruptive ideas.
Business Friendly: You can analyze customer needs, cut through ambiguity and propose analytical solutions that drive towards impactful business outcomes.
Twenty-five years after Capital One was started its still led by its founder. Be ready to join a fun group of super smart folkswho see the customer first, and want to use their machine learning skills to make a difference.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree plus 2 years of experience in data analytics, or Masters degree in computer science or with a Machine Learning focus plus 1 year of experience in data analytics, or PhD
At least 3 years programming experience in one or more of the following: Python, Scala, C/C++, R
At least 2 years experience building Machine Learning solutions over open source platforms (like TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, CNTK, Caffe, DSSTNE.)
At least 2 years experience designing and developing enterprise-scale ML solutions in one or more of: Computer Vision/Image Recognition, Product Recommendation System, Personalization, NLP, Clickstream Analytics, Marketing Response Models
At least 2 years experience evaluating and leveraging various deep learning approaches or Neural Network architectures (CNNs, RNNs)
Preferred Qualifications:
PhD with Machine Learning research focus
Academic thesis or published papers in ML space or robust public source code repository with ML solution(s)
Presentations or publications at top-tier AI/Machine Learning conferences
Open source contributions in ML space
Prior experience supporting consumer products/services or marketing applications
At least 1 year experience working in cloud environment
Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Why CrowdStrike?

With its explosive-growth, tripling year over year, CrowdStrike is a global cybersecurity company. In 2017, we reached the $1 Billion Valuation, having $256M invested by Google Capital, Accel, Warburg Pincus and other leading VCs. Recently, Forbes called CrowdStrike “The World’s Newest Unicorn” in the security space, and for good reason too. CrowdStrike was the first to pin the data breach at the Democratic National Committee on Russia, and provides the most comprehensive product offerings in the cybersecurity space. We are laser focused on preventing major cyber breaches that destroy organizations and individual lives.

Why choose a career in cybersecurity? In the next five years, over $1 trillion will be spent on cybersecurity, making it the fastest growing and one of the only recession proof sectors of tech. But more specifically, why CrowdStrike? It’s simple - speed of innovation, industry recognition, generous compensation/benefits, dedicated sales enablement program, track record of promoting from within rapidly, abundant tools and resources, and a fun and supportive work environment in a hot and innovative space.

Experience: 2 - 4 years' experience in a marketing/project management or events management role, and experience doing data analysis

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline
Superior project and stakeholder management skills
Data and analytical skills
Attention to detail
Systemic or holistic thinking
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detailed Responsibilities:
Project Management
Develop and drive action plans to deliver the vertical roadmap milestones and track/report on progress vs. plan
Participate in key leadership and broader business meetings or conference calls, disseminating meeting materials and agendas, coordinating meeting events, recording feedback/actions from meetings, and tracking actions agreed to as part of the project plan
Anticipate resource gaps and other execution challenges early to ensure key vertical activities and deliverables are on track
Act as the custodian of Technology Vertical materials (case studies, proposal materials, Go to Market materials etc.) for the vertical and ensure they are updated on a quarterly basis, working with Solutions, lines of business and Global Client Managers (GCMs) as needed and shared with stakeholders
Work with the Marketing team to plan and execute marketing events for the Technology Industry sector (Round Tables, conferences, etc.)
Operational Reporting & Data Analysis
Manage revenue, sales, and account performance metrics dashboard for Technology Industry client portfolio and provide planned and ad hoc updates to internal teams
Co-develop and refresh sales and revenue reporting communications for Multinational Client Group (MCG) Leadership and other internal stakeholders
Determine and implement operational and reporting efficiencies (e.g. through process improvement or leveraging technologies like tableau); and/or determine how to optimize current reporting processes
Conduct analysis of client growth plans and assess market trends as needed to determine growth targets for the 2019 portfolio
Candidate preferred to sit in TX, but could work from the below locations:
Mercer Dallas: 4400 Comerica Bank Tower, 1717 Main Street, Dallas, TX 75201
Mercer San Francisco: Four Embarcadero Center, Suite 400, San Francisco, CA 94111
Mercer/Client San Jose: 1735 Technology Drive, Suite 790, San Jose, CA 95110
Thanks & Regards,
Prithwiraj Chakraborty
Associate Recruiter
360 Mt. Kemble Avenue, Suite 2000 | Morristown, NJ 07960

Email: *********************** | Website: **************
LinkedIn: ******************************************
Artech is the #1 Largest Women-Owned IT Staffing Company in the US!
Connect with us on - LinkedIn | Facebook |

Hotels.com

Manager Acquisition Marketing Analytics

Are you passionate about data, analytics and digital marketing? Would you like to be leading a team that is solving the toughest problems in online marketing, in partnership with some of the brightest and most advanced marketers in the world? And all of that whilst working in the dynamic, competitive, customer-focused and data-rich world of online travel?

Hotels.com are looking for an astute, consultative, passionate, individual with a strong analytical and business background to fill the Manager, Acquisition Marketing Analytics role. The role, and team, will have analytical ownership of high-visibility initiatives across Search Engine Marketing and Online Advertising, furthering our understanding and driving strategic decisions within a core part of our business.

Reporting to the Director of Mobile & Acquisition Marketing Analytics, you will be working closely with all the other leaders in the team, as well as teams across all Hotels.com functions such as Marketing, Finance, Data Science and Online Product. You will also collaborate with experts at our key marketing partners such as Google and Facebook, as well as leading and mentoring two highly skilled junior analysts.

This job is for you if you bring a rare blend of analytical excellence, strong business focus, and exceptional team leadership, and are seeking a challenging and exciting role within a dynamic, fast-paced and fun business.

What Youll Do:
Applying advanced analytical techniques to identify optimisation levers and influence marketing strategy
Collaborating with our Marketing Data Science team to identify opportunities and embed machine learning techniques within our marketing activities
Designing and evaluating tests to optimise incremental customer acquisition
Understanding and proactively communicating factors affecting trading performance to stakeholders including Hotels.com leadership team
Partnering with our Digital Analytics and Data Engineering teams to ensure robust and accurate data capture and continuous improvement of data available for both analytics and the wider business
Developing and defining analytical vision, strategy and roadmap for the team, coordinating with leaders within the marketing team to ensure alignment with business goals
Managing and developing a team of 2 analysts, prioritising their workload, providing mentorship and guidance, and ensuring the accuracy and relevance of the teams deliverables
Knowledge sharing through presentations at regional, channel and business wide events, as well as building relationships with analytics teams across EG sister brands
Who You Are:
Proven experience of using R (or similar tools) to structure, transform and visualise big data
Strong SQL skills are a requirement hands on use of big data in large projects using Hadoop, Presto or Spark a bonus
Experience leading or mentoring junior analysts
Solid understanding of online marketing, preferably in a past or current role, with experience of Search Engine Marketing or other PPC style marketing partners a plus
Experience within a large ecommerce environment beneficial
5+ years experience working in a role focused on analytics, statistical modelling, data science or similar
Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science or similar
A relevant Masters degree a plus
Travel industry experience a plus
Why Join Us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.

*LI-BSTEWARD

LPS-ARM-NA

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

job_name: Software Product Data Management - Junior Level

job_description:
Position Details
Position Information
Title of Position Internal Audit Data Analyst
Requisition Number BES20180451P
Department Posting Name Audit & Consulting Services
Location Main Campus
Recruitment Type External
Position Type This is a Classified, benefits eligible, position.
Grant Funded? No
Hours per week 40
If employee will be working a schedule other than Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm, specify hours and days to be worked
If Temporary, Ending Date
Recruiting Rate Commensurate
Beginning Salary Flexibility Yes
Pay Basis Salary
Required Education Bachelor's Degree
Do you want to allow additional experience to substitute for required education? Yes (1 Year Experience = 1 Year Education)
Preferred Education
Field of Study

Prefer advanced degree, certifications or other relevant training in Data Analysis or Data Science beyond bachelor’s degree.
MS Office Experience Required Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
Will this position require driving a UT or personally owned vehicle? No
Other Computer and Software Skills Required

Proficient in one or more data analytics tools

Proficiency in Microsoft EXCEL

Proficient in SQL programming language and the SQL Management Suite
Experience and Other Skills Required

2-3 years experience in performing data analytics and the related concepts, including (but not limited to) statistical/regresssion analysis.

Highly developed technical skills with demonstrated ability to add value, provide insights and influence outcomes/decisions through analytical processes

Understanding of typical business processes/cycles

Experience working with and analyzing large, complex data sets.

Strong oral communication skills including presentations to management/leadership

Demonstrates strong critical thinking skills and analytical abilities
Do you want to allow additional education to substitute for required experience? Yes (2 Years Education = 1 Year Experience)
Other Skills Preferred

Working knowledge of and/or use of data analytics tools currently utilized by UTSA (Power BI, Cognos, SPLUNK)

Working knowledge of advanced Microsoft Office 365 features/tools such as Sharepoint, Azure, and OneDrive for Business, EXCEL power addins and slicers

Knowledge of UTSA IT systems, applications, data sets/structures, etc

Working knowledge and understanding of the Texas Administrative Code 202 (Information Security) and UTSA Information Security policies
Description of Job Duties

Typical:

1. Serve as key audit team member, providing data-related technical support, data extraction, analysis and summarization of results for audit projects. Identify, obtain and prepare relevant data for other members of the department and also perform various analytics consistent with audit/project objectives, including (but not limited to) trends, outliers, classifications, and stratifications. Responsibilities require an ongoing, working knowledge of significant sources of relevant data throughout the university including Information Technology (IT) system and related applications along with the underlying data structures and definitions. Collaborate with business partners to gain an understanding of existing reporting systems and data repositories. Develop data collection methodology to extract relevant data required to support audit initiatives.

2. Obtain necessary access to such data/systems and maintain appropriate knowledge of available data for execution of internal audit responsiblities. Such systems include (but are not limited to) PeopleSoft, BANNER, System and Security Logs, and related tools (e.g. Cognos, PowerBI, SQL, SPLUNK) along with other databases and systems housed in or maintained by central functions and units across the university.

3. Develop and maintain a strong working relationship with key personnel from IT, student and financial operations, and other significant customer bases. The IA Data Analyst will work with the Office of Information Technology (OIT) and others to identify appropriate data sources and, where necessary, develop custom data views/reports to facilitate the achievement of internal audit objectives.

4. Work effectively and efficiently with large and complex data sets and be comfortable with related concepts including data validation, relating and merging/joing data sources, field identification and safeguarding of confidential information.

5. As a key team member, works with the audit/project team on project scoping and development of audit plans including areas for and types of analytics to be performed, as well as relevant sources of data

6. Prepare visualtions (graphs/charts) and other reports based on the audit analytics performed and work with clients throughout the university to review analytics processes and results, discuss potential areas of concern, develop custom analyses or reports, and identify and assess ares for additional analysis.

7. Serve as an experienced resource and provides guidance and advice in support of group members on technical projects.

8. Under the direction of the Internal Audit Management team, examine ways to continuously improve the efficiency of internal processes through automation.

9. Serve as leader in identifying new strategies for report design, data analysis, and data mining in support of the Audit team.
Posting Open Date 09/20/2018
Posting Close Date at midnight on
Open Until Filled Yes
Special Notes To Applicants

-UTSA is a tobacco-free campus.

-UTSA is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

-This is a security sensitive position. Employment is contingent upon a successful background check.

-Applicants who are selected for interviews must be able to show proof that they are eligible and qualified to work in the United States by time of hire.

-At the discretion of the hiring department, this position posting may be closed once a sufficient number of qualified applications has been received.
company_name: University of Texas at San Antonio

job_description:
Our client base is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a key individual to join our team of experts and help drive our continued success. Our Clinical Program Manager works under the Vice President of Clinical Innovation and is a CDI thought leader, provides clinical documentation subject matter expertise to drive product innovation, completes medical record reviews and provides education to clinical staff regarding common CDI documentation opportunities as well as transfer of knowledge regarding use of Iodine products.

Please note - relocation to Austin, TX is NOT a requirement of this role.

What You’ll Do
Product Innovation
Collaborate with the product design team as a subject matter expert to define and design the clinical elements that drive our SmartList product suite
Provide insights from client interactions to inform future research initiatives and drive product roadmaps
Perform medical record review to identify client issues and create action plans for process improvement
Audit performance of key data science conditions and elements
Client Education and Success
Engage with client CDI teams and support successful implementation of Smartlist products
Partner with Client Success team to drive product penetration within client accounts and to ensure client satisfaction and retention
Develop and provide education regarding clinical concepts to clients and internal stakeholders and product designers
Develop knowledge articles to continually expand and improve Iodine Software’s internal and external assets
Create and present monthly CDI/clinical Education sessions to our broad client base
What You’ll Need
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Nursing (RN)
8+ years of clinical experience in an acute care environment,
2 years in an advanced CDI role preferred
2+ years of experience as a CDI Consultant strongly preferred, with a heavy emphasis on CDI program assessment and implementation
Deep understanding of clinical documentation, medical record coding, healthcare billing and revenue cycle management
Outstanding presentation skills and proven ability to successfully facilitate group discussions to a desired outcome
Team player DNA with a desire to solve for the interests of our clients and of our business
Self-starter, who is extremely motivated to demonstrate success
Experience with CDI, CAC or Coding software applications
Attention to detail, highly organized, with an absolute focus on quality of work
Ability to travel up to 50%, if necessary
Credentialed (CCDS) and active membership with ACDIS preferred
What You’ll Get:

This is a unique opportunity to personally drive innovation in the space that you know and love. You will be introducing and supporting brand-new technologies to CDI teams and initiating widespread changes to the way they interact with patient data and each other. You will be building strategic partnerships, creating real value for large healthcare organizations, and influencing product direction in an ever-changing space. You will join a passionate and committed team, with a proven record of success building revolutionary healthcare technology. Join us and be a part of the future of CDI.

The Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Capabilities and Technologies (C&T) group leads interdisciplinary applied research and development (R&D) for all of IIS. R&D ranges from concept development, trade studies, and rapid prototyping for customized engineering products and services. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.

Raytheon is looking to fill a technical position in Dulles, VA. The level and salary grade is contingent upon skillset, experience, and education. The candidate will join a small, agile group of engineers focused on applying state of the art computer vision (CV) and machine learning (ML) approaches to a variety of customer problems. Modern CV and ML approaches are inherently interdisciplinary, integrating concepts from Physics, Computer Science, Neuroscience, Data Science, among other fields. Therefore, the candidate must be capable of working across technical fields to integrate multi-disciplinary concepts. The candidate must be capable of communicating ideas and concepts to a variety of stakeholders through whitepapers, presentations, and/or computer code. The candidate must be able to code.

This position can be a G08 or G09 based on education, experience and skillset. The position can be worked at Dulles, VA or Richardson, TX.

Required Skills:

- Must be a US citizen with a Security Clearance or the ability to obtain and maintain a clearance.
4-6 years of work experience with Bachelors degree.
Demonstrable experience in a higher-level programming language such as C/C++, Python, or Java (code samples and/or projects will be required)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The candidate will be expected to research and develop new concepts and then articulate and defend those concepts to the rest of the team.
Image processing background is required for mid-level positions
Desired Skills:
A college major or concentration in fields related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and/or Artificial Intelligence techniques is highly desirable
Ability to work in fast paced, multi-disciplinary environment
Experience with one or more scientific analysis and prototyping environments such as SciPy/NumPy stack, R, or MATLAB.
Experience and portfolio projects available via GitHub, GitLab, etc. are highly desired (please provide links with resume).
Existing TS/SCI clearance strongly preferred.
Required Education (including Major):

B.S. in Computer Science, Physics, Math, Electrical Engineering or similar quantitative focused degree. Advanced degree preferred.

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Googles global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Cloud Sales Engineer Manager you will lead a team of pre-sales engineers who are trusted technical advisors to our higher education customers for the Google Cloud Platform and G Suite for Education. Higher education customers, including 4 year colleges, research universities and junior/community colleges, have unique characteristics you will learn in this customer-facing technical sales role.

In this role, you will interact and manage a diverse group of engineering professionals. Additionally, you will maintain technical expertise and be prepared to engage directly with prospects as the opportunities presents themselves. You will work cross-functionally with our Product, Support, Engineering and Sales teams. As a leader of an entrepreneurial team, you will help shape the future of how technology is used in higher education by managing large accounts, building relationships, emphasizing the value of technology in research and education and building technical solutions in cutting-edge research areas.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build whats next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.

## Responsibilities
Collaborate with Sales and Customer Engineering (CE) management to determine proper staffing levels to support annualized sales goals, establish job requisitions, assemble candidate pool and lead the interview team to fill open positions.
Assess CE teams go-to-market readiness, identify gaps in CE preparedness and build plans to ensure the CE team is properly trained and equipped to successfully perform in support of annualized sales goals.
Work with Google Cloud Sales team leadership to identify, qualify and prioritize coverage for sales opportunities and participate in periodic opportunity review meetings to provide insight on ways to grow our business.
Work with the Sales Account team, Customer Support, Product Management, Customer Solutions and Engineering to resolve product challenges affecting pre and post-sales customer satisfaction.
Travel up to 50% of the time to visit customers across a defined geographic territory.
## Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience as a technical field engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a similar customer facing role.
Preferred qualifications:
MBA and/or Master's degree in Computer Science.
7 years of experience as a customer-facing field engineer or 3 years of experience as a field engineer manager.
Experience with HPC computing paradigms and related technologies (e.g. SLURM, Broad GATK) in relation to Life Sciences data processing pipelines.
Experience in data and information management and big data trends.
Experience with Linux and the software lifecycle and an understanding of application development platforms, enterprise networking, identity management systems, PaaS, SaaS, IaaS, public cloud and related industry and technical concepts.
Demonstrated ability to tailor messages to diverse audiences, translating technical expertise through common simple language.

Code Pilot is hiring a Full Stack Developer to join our growing team and change the paradigm in an established industry. We're looking for a passionate team member with the ability to take direction, execute, and work in a fast paced environment. You will be working on a two sided marketplace platform, connecting to many external APIs, responsive web, iOS and android clients.
Who You Are
You have an ownership mentality and track record of successful high-quality results. You identify any ambiguous requirements and provide clarity when needed.

job_description:
Company Overview

The Cognito platform from Vectra provides continuous, automated threat surveillance to proactively expose hidden and unknown cyberattackers that actively spread inside networks.

The genesis of Cognito is based on a simple principle for finding hidden threats: use an authoritative source of data and seek out the fundamental threat behaviors that cybercriminals can’t avoid when they carry out an attack.

To do this, Cognito relies on the only source of truth during a cyberattack – network traffic. Only traffic on the wire – whether in private data centers, public clouds or enterprise environments – reveals the truth with complete fidelity and independence. Low-fidelity perimeter security only shows what you’ve already seen, not the hidden attacks that were missed.

Cognito delivers a far more efficient way of analyzing network traffic at scale. Instead of traditional payload inspection, it uses AI, machine learning and behavioral traffic analysis to expose the fundamental behaviors of attackers as they spy, spread, and steal in the network – even in encrypted traffic. By automating cyberattacker detection, analysis and incident response, Cognito AI condenses days or weeks of work into minutes, reducing the threat investigation workload. For more details, see https://vectra.ai/how-it-works.

Position Overview

The Vectra Engineering team is a small and constantly growing team of individuals. We look for people that are smart, very capable technically, and have fun solving the challenges that our customers face together as a team. We believe strongly that everyone can and should have significant impacts on the growth of the product as well as the company and our culture. We believe in using the right technology for each problem and building knowledge through mentorship and other things like peer code reviews. We're excited to find others to join the team that want to work on an interesting product that solves real problems.

As part of the Engineering team, Platform Engineers will work directly on the Cognito product platform to solve complex problems. This may include things like:
Working to build high performance platforms (imagine supporting 100Gbps feeds in realtime)
Writing high speed parsers for feature extraction from network protocols
Building services and APIs to drive on-going development of algorithms and applications
Working on a variety of form-factors including bare-metal, virtual machines (in public and private clouds), and containers
Augmenting cloud infrastructure for updates, monitoring, and telemetry
The ideal candidate is a team player who is excited to work with a variety of technologies and enjoys solving many different problems.

Responsibilities
Work in Python or C++ on a daily basis to build enterprise-level features
Evaluate and identify the correct approaches or technologies to use to solve problems
Work with product management to help define requirements for new high value features for customers
Work with our data science and security research teams to build new or enrich current parsers and models
Deliver software with automated tests in a modern CI toolchain
Qualifications
Required
BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Python or C++ experience
Detailed knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and parallel computing
Unix/Linux proficiency
Experience with a source control system, preferably Git
Preferred
Experience with more recent C++11, 14, and 17 features
Networking knowledge (L3-L7 protocols)
Robust security skills including firewall or IDS experience
Understanding of database internals beyond basic queries and interaction
Experience with REST APIs
Performance tuning skills

Job Location : Location US-TX-Dallas
Type Regular Full-Time
Category/Department Engineering

Overview

We are looking for a highly qualified individual who is passionate about emerging technologies to join Suffolk's Information Technology Team and run one of our industry-first Smart Labs located in Dallas.

This role will work closely with partners and stakeholders within Suffolk's Dallas Region, and with members of the Innovation and Data Teams nationwide to engage the organization with new technologies, increase utilization of the Smart Lab, and ensure coordination and sharing of new initiatives across projects. This person will play a core role in Suffolk's transformation to a digital and data-driven company.

Suffolk's Smart Lab Directors are technology generalists with an area of technical specialization. They are adept communicators about the value of technology to both technical and non-technical audiences, particularly clients or potential clients. They are also strong collaborators who can partner with field and corporate resources to identify opportunities and execute plans that drive value for Suffolk and its clients.
They are part of a team that is focused on high potential areas of disruptive change and serve to connect innovative efforts throughout the organization.

Based in our Dallas office, the Smart Lab Director will have three areas of focus:

Be part of Suffolk's efforts to build up its development capabilities. The Smart Lab Director will partner with Operations stakeholders to design and code intuitive and easy to use field and mobile applications.

Explore new ways of creating value for Suffolk and our clients by enhancing the value of our planning and control process and leveraging our virtual design and construction efforts through enhanced visualization, solutions development, data integration and research into other potentially disruptive technologies. In addition, they will showcase our Build Smart capabilities and drive the conversation around innovation within the region.

Oversees the management of the day-to-day Smart Lab operations and provides technology support within the office and region.

The ideal candidate is versatile, collaborative, passionate about technology, eager to learn, and willing and able to support the team in multiple ways. The individual needs to have in-depth knowledge of at least one programming language and be familiar with a variety of operating systems and platforms; familiarity with 'low code/no code' solutions is a plus. The candidate must be comfortable working in cross-functional teams, have an analytical mindset, and be able to work with little supervision. This is the perfect opportunity to join a trailblazing organization looking to transform the way we build and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is designing and putting in place the digital operating model for construction.

Responsibilities
Development resource
Build field and mobile applications to streamline workflows
Build integrations between field and mobile applications and core applications and databases
Understand client requirements and how they translate to application features
Collaborate with a team of IT and Data professionals to set specifications for new applications
Design creative prototypes according to specifications
Create intuitive user interfaces with an eye for design
Communicate effectively with stakeholders throughout development process
Work with external development teams if required to accelerate application development
SmartLab strategist & evangelist
Demonstrate the business value created by technology and solutions represented in the Lab
Lead engagement efforts around innovation in the region
Identify and drive opportunities to engage employees and partners to ensure clear understanding of value and deliverables from the Lab
Serve as regional expert on innovation initiatives across Suffolk, contributing to research, development, and testing efforts
Engage in the research and development of disruptive solutions which have the potential to change how the construction industry operates
Work collaboratively with employees to leverage the lab and understand what innovative solutions can be effective moving the business forward
Facilitate the idea generation and piloting process in partnership with business owners
Partner with Learning and Development to ensure transition from successful pilots of new initiatives to deployment
General operational support
Ensure the technology in the Lab is operational
Responsible for the digital content used in the Lab and communicating its applicability to creating business value
Oversee the implementation of advances in our technology and solutions as they are developed
Provide technology support within the office and region on an as-needed basis
Qualifications

Qualifications:
Passion for understanding how technology can be used for competitive advantage; preference for candidates who demonstrate awareness of the latest tools and trends in software development and data science
Ability to successfully manage in a test and learn, rapid iteration environment in support of piloting solutions
Ability to think past current constraints and influence others to gain buy-in and alignment
Ability to be a cultural change leader who can drive results through direct and indirect influence
Energetic, enthusiastic self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills and an eye for detail
Proven experience as an application developer
A team player with excellent collaboration skills
Analytical thinking and problem-solving capability
Creative, with design mindset
BSc/BA in computer science or relevant field; MSc/MA a plus
Experience in a construction or a construction-related field
Experience with other Innovation Lab environments a plus
Necessary Attributes:
Experience in a construction or a construction-related field
Experience with other Innovation Lab environments a plu
Demonstrates Suffolk's core values of hard work, professionalism, integrity, passion and caring
Proactive, self-starter with the ability to work with minimal oversight
Strong collaborator and communicator
Working Conditions

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for long periods of time; talk or hear; perform fine motor, hand and finger skills in the use of a keyboard, telephone, or writing. The employee is frequently required to stands; walk; and reach with arms and/or hands. Specific vision abilities include close vision, distance vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. The employee will spend their time in an office environment with a quiet to moderate noise level. Job site walking.

Be a part of a high-energy, diverse, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. job_description:
At AT&T we bring the world together with technology in ways you never imagined. With a range of products and services enhancing how you live, play and work, were keeping you connected to the future. We rely on the latest in data sciences and engineering to curate, analyze and improve our customer experience and operations.
The Opportunity
The Chief Data Office team at AT&T strives to lead transformation through data-driven decisions that advance the customer experience and businesses around the world. With access to one of the coolest and largest data sets available, we enable the discovery and development of meaningful insights that inspire continuous innovation.
We are seeking an experienced self-driven software engineer who is comfortable being part of a small skunk works team responsible for building, designing, and end-to-end ownership of an operational prototype tasked to deliver intelligent data driven products.
Come help us solve exciting problems at scale by bringing your ideas, passion, critical thinking, and fearless attitude.
Responsibilities
Design and implement scalable prototypes that deliver data driven intelligence
Take initiative to identify new opportunities and implement creative solutions
Provide technical leadership, collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams and help drive product vision.
BS/MS/PhD degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research or similar technical field of study preferred.
Requires 5-8 years of experience.
Experience with multiple programming languages including Java
Experience with backend software design and development with Linux
Experience with algorithm development
Experience with distributed computing
Experience with databases (Relational and NoSQL)
A healthy dose of curiosity and skepticism coupled with a hunger to learn
A willingness to navigate ambiguity to deliver complex, complete solutions
Requires Daily Office Presence in Plano, TX.

We are empowering our clients with actionable analytics in order to positively impact peoples’ lives. The insights we gain from our analyses guide our strategic path forward as we empower non-profit and public-sector organizations to build prescriptive paths forward for the people they serve. The Data Science team proactively leads and collaborates to identify the most valuable problems to solve, constructs a Roadmap to delivery, and executes our plan. The Lead Data Scientist role will have an empowered role to build the Data Science Roadmap in conjunction with the Product team at Social Solutions. All the outputs from the Data Science team models will feed into the Product portfolio, aiding thousands of internal and external stakeholders in their decision-making processes. The Lead Data Scientist will be a player/coach on the team, mentoring and leading analysts while delivering these incredibly valuable outputs across our organization.

What You’ll Do
Aid in the development of predictive modeling and machine learning solutions that continually improve with the collection of real-time program results from our product portfolio
Lead a team of data analysts as a player-coach, mentoring each individual to continue to develop their personal skillsets while contributing to model development as needed
Coordinate KPI goals and delivery dates with senior leadership, ensuring our results are measurable and delivered on time
Work in an Agile environment with team members, delivering solutions quickly and continuously exploring ways to improve our results
Actively seek out new potential problems to solve, building out our future Roadmap while simultaneously executing our present analyses
Work closely with colleagues in Product, Operations, and Sales to structure problems and understand the impact across various departments within the company
Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field. If you can tell a story related to how you can leverage your educational background on a data science team, we are all ears
5+ years in a Data Science position, building predictive models and leading teams
Experience designing and implementing a broad range of Regression techniques
Experience designing and implementing Machine Learning models (preferable)
Experience coding with R, Python, and SQL languages
Familiarity with Spark and Amazon Web Services (preferable)
Ability to clearly explain findings from complex analyses in case studies and power point
Be a collaborative teammate, sharing knowledge and learning from others while working through complex problems
Confidence, hustle, energy, and drive – accountability is key and the impact of your work is crucial to our success
You are always ready for the next challenge, always one step ahead, looking for creative ways to improve upon processes
Why We’re Awesome

At Social Solutions, we’re mission focused and results oriented! We’re a diverse team of innovators, creatives, and digital architects that come together to help organizations transform lives. Social Solutions’ software (SaaS) helps some of the most vulnerable human beings in our society. Our software for Nonprofits allows them to spend less time on compliance and more time on ensuring the effectiveness of their service programs for the people who rely on them. Since our software was designed by direct service works for direct service providers, it also helps them to demonstrate impact to stakeholders.

What You’ll Get
Amazing coworkers
100% employer paid benefits for employees
8 hours per quarter of volunteer time
Company sponsored events and happy hours
Career advancement opportunities
That’s not all, folks!
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Description:
Job Title:

Principal Data Engineer
Location:

Houston

Company

For the past 40 years, Wood Mackenzie has established its reputation as a trusted source of intelligence, enriching lives by empowering clients with unique insight on the world’s natural resources.

Now, as part of the Verisk family, that legacy is even stronger. Aligning with the world’s leading data analytics company extends our ability to support clients with our unrivalled analysis and advice.

Together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence that informs the strategy that will ultimately shape the future direction of our global natural resources.

Team Description

The Analytics Lab team at Wood Mackenzie is working to find new ways of unlocking value for clients through data and analytics. We are building a collaborative environment that facilitates bespoke data sharing within Study Groups of clients to conduct pilot projects to evaluate the power of predictive models on combined datasets.

Role Purpose

Wood Mackenzie is seeking a Principal Data Engineer to join our Analytics Lab team to generate innovative data solutions that will solve complex business problems in collaboration with our clients. They will have experience in applying data mining techniques, extracting data from a variety of sources and data types, complex data transformations, and preparing tidy data sets suitable for machine learning algorithms. They should have strong communication and interpersonal skills and will be able to explain the provenance and quality of final data sets to colleagues from all areas of the business and to clients.

The role requires a strong data-focussed personality, with a keen eye for detail. They should have experience of working in a data environment with multiple streams of data. We are looking for someone who has an innovative approach to working with data and is willing to learn technologies that create new data solutions.

This successful candidate for this role must have a strong technology background, and understand the challenges of building a modern data centric business. Proven technical experience in data transformation and collaborative data science in a cloud or shared data environment. Achieving results will hinge on an ability to work collaboratively with colleagues across organizations and stakeholder groups, developing creative solutions to new problems, and leveraging the expertise and talents of Wood Mackenzie and the wider Verisk company group.

Main Responsibilities
Working with Analytics Lab team members and Technology division leaders to define the technical roadmap for data used in analytics – informing and challenging on technical and business directions.
Design, prototype and productize data sets that are used both internally and externally for predictive analytics
Support other data professionals (internal and external) in the adoption of industry leading data tools/frameworks that enable predictive analytics
Collaborate with our internal research teams to ensure data inputs and outputs are interpreted and utilized in predictive data sets correctly and appropriately in context
Develop tools to explore and interrogate datasets to communicate the completeness, quality, provenance, and fidelity of the underlying data
Deploy solutions to a shared cloud environment (AWS) and facilitate the data set preparation and data science activities for the team and clients in this environment
Build tools and reports to ensure information security and data protection requirements are adhered to as agreed with clients
Regularly feedback learnings and contribute experience and perspective to various other stakeholder groups at Wood Mackenzie
Act as, and be seen as, a respected and trusted adviser


Knowledge & Experience
Adept at AWS based deployments of data processes and data science
Experience of building and managing production data pipelines using a variety of technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, Athena...) to deliver data in a variety of formats
Experience of building and supporting data science activities using a variety of technologies (such as Jupyter notebooks, R Studio / Shiny, Tensorflow)
Experience of building and running Real-time data streaming solutions using technologies like Kafka or Kinesis
Hands on experience with schema/message design and modelling
Expert level Python, with working knowledge or comfort level with some other languages (including, not limited to, Java, R, .NET, Julia, etc.)
Delivered data projects to data science teams.
Excellent understanding of advancements in Data Science and how this can contribute to improvements within data engineering.
Experience scaling data processing and/or ML algorithms over large scale, distributed computing environments and other high performance solutions (e.g. GPUs) is a plus
Core Competencies
Excellent communication skills, including mentoring more junior developers and discussing architectural designs at abstract and more tangible implementation levels
Strong organization and planning skills and the ability to manage own workload and that of others within sometimes tight timescales
The ability to work as part of a team involving multiple locations and time zones
Commitment to excellence and meeting high quality standards expected by our clients
Attention to detail, high standard of excellence, passionate about the value-add from high quality data engineering


WoodMackenzie Core Values

Wood Mackenzie is a place where we are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment, which encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging.

Our core values are:
Respect for the Individual
Integrity
Passion
Persistence
Confidence with humility
Excellence
Teamwork
We understand the importance of achieving balance between work, family and other life commitments. We are open to considering flexible working arrangements to enable the greatest spectrum of talent to contribute to Wood Mackenzie's success.

EEO statement

Unsolicited resumes submitted to Maplecroft by any external recruitment agency via Internet, e-mail, fax, or U.S. mail become the property of Wood Mackenzie and we are not responsible for any fees associated with those resumes.

You can request reasonable accommodations sending an email to hrenquiries@woodmac.com.

At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world -- in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals -- that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve.

Abbott Neuromodulation develops advanced medical implants and accessories for the stimulus of the nervous system and sensing of biomarkers. We are on the forefront of implantable device miniaturization and data science for improved patient outcomes. Through advanced embedded sensing and external mobile device apps we create an ecosystem for developing quick advancements in the field of neuromodulation through modern data science and analysis in a closed loop system. This position works independently to design new products, fixtures, and development tools in a fast-paced cross-functional design environment. Stays current on new technologies and design practices and utilizes them in new designs. Provides instruction, oversight, and mentoring to other design engineers. Exhibits quality in their work and pushes for excellence in themselves and the team.
*Job Duties**
+ Owns embedded system development from requirements through commercial launch

+ Applies advanced engineering and scientific principles to circuit designs to reduce design risk and optimize designs

+ Develops models and applies data analysis and statistics to optimize designs

+ Effectively solves electromagnetic design challenges through analysis, simulation, and characterization

+ Performs tasks independently while effectively utilizing other team members

+ Mentors and trains other design engineers

+ This is a non-supervisory role
*Required Qualifications**
+ Master?s degree in electrical engineering or related field

+ 7+ years of relevant electrical engineering experience in the design and analysis of embedded PCB assemblies

+ Strong ability to apply electromagnetic theory analytically

+ Working knowledge of statistics & data analysis

+ Key contributor to at least 5 PCB development cycles

+ Strong verbal and written communication skills
*Desired Qualifications**
+ Doctorate in electrical engineering or related field

+ Experience with data analysis and/or machine learning

+ Experience with firmware / C# development

+ Experience with medical device development

An Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Description
Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

 

*This is a pipeline requisition to gather applicants for a soon to be posted territory*

 
Sell snake, scorpion and spider antivenoms in a fast-paced emergency medicine environment. IQVIA™ - The Human Data Science Company™ is excited to partner with Rare Disease Therapeutics, Inc. to expand the only FDA approved treatment for patients with clinical signs of scorpion envenomation (ANASCORP®), and to successfully lead the launch of ANAVIP® within their expanding antivenom portfolio. The successful candidate will play an integral role to educate healthcare professionals in the areas of emergency medicine, surgery, toxicology, poison control, and pharmacy about the antivenoms. For this opportunity we are searching for a unique combination of entrepreneurial spirit, a passion to exceed all expectations and an overriding curiosity to explore and continually learn about venomous reptiles and arachnids. This is a rare opportunity with IQVIA™ and America’s first exclusively orphan drug company.
 
 Hospital Sales Account Executive  
The hospital sales focused Account Executive is primarily responsible for achieving sales forecast and gaining access of promoted products and, subsequently, sales of products within assigned territory. This is accomplished by establishing mutually beneficial, long-term business relationships with those healthcare providers that are dedicated to treating patients that have been envenomated, and are key to the sales success of promoted products.

IQVIA offers a friendly, progressive work atmosphere and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance and vision coverage, tuition assistance, bonus plan and 401(k).
 
We look forward to the prospect of working with you! Please apply on-line at: www.IQVIA.com

IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
 
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.
 
Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!
 
We invite you to join IQVIA™.
